elementText.text: Receipt concerning the return of livestock: The Puqudeans return the stolen goods (ultu libbi hubti, lit. “from the robbery”) of 8 livestock animals (mīru) and 10 young livestock animals (būru).

elementText.text:
Partly broken purchase of a built house: A purchases from B1 and B2 a built house (bītu epšu) for 1 2/3 minas of silver. The sold house is located in Cutha (further details broken) and measures 637 square cubits (147 m2). Its upper side (in the south) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the north) on the house of C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the house of C3 and its lower front (in the west) on the house of C4. 4(+) witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller(s).
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Sîn-karābī-išmi; B1 = Sîn-ahu-iddin; B2 = […]u-uṣur/[…]; C1 = Eri[…]; C2 = […]; C3 = Iqīša/Nabû-šumu-iškun; C4 = Ahhē-lūmur; Scribe = Bulluṭ//Šūzubu

A certain amount of animals is at the disposal of (ina pāni) Munnabittu.

elementText.text:
Court decision in Babylon: A1 and A2 bring a lawsuit against B before the assembly (puhru) of the citizens of Babylon concerning the prebend (isqu) of the cella (bīt papāhi) of the Šamaš Temple in Sippar which is patrimonial property of B. While they claim that they bought (kî kaspi mahāru) the prebend for 2 minas and 11 shekels of silver, B states that he only received 1 mina and 9 shekels of silver from C and A1. Following the decision of the assembly, B weighed out and paid (hâṭu nadānu) 1 mina and 9 shekels of silver to the claimants. For the remainder of 1 mina and 2 shekels of silver B has to take an oath (tamītu) at a temple (details are broken). Broken witness list and the scribe (name broken).
 
A1 = Bēl-iddin; A2 = Marduk; B = Šumu-iddin//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Murānu

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): B approaches A and asks to lead away (abāku) and keep alive (bulluṭu) his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for 6 shekels of silver. A accepts B’s offer and hands over the money. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Ninurta-uballiṭ/Bēl-usāti; B = Nergal-ahu-uṣur/Iqīša; fC = Ṣullēa-tašmē

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 1/3 minas and 2 ½ shekels of silver. As soon as the purchase price in Dûzu (IV), after the barley harvest, is set (uzuzzu) in Babylon, B will give to A 200 kor (3,600 l) of barley. B will pay the remainder (šittu) of the silver which is left (râhu) without interest (qaqqadu) within one year (ina ṭuppi). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumu-ukīn/Isināya; B = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Mukallim; Scribe = Nummuru//Šigûa

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The house of B is placed as a pledge. 2/3 out of 1 mina of silver is for the right of B to continue to live in his pledged house. The remainder of 1/3 mina of silver bears an interest of 1/5 shekel of silver per 1 shekel (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-zēru-ibni//Bēl-ibni; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Malāhu; Scribe = Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ninurta-iddin

elementText.text:
Purchase of land: A1 and A2 purchase from B one share (zittu) of hanšû-land belonging to C for 6 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû). Both B and C form part of the Ilūtu-bāni Family. The sold share of land is located in the lower part of the city of Bēl-iqbi. It measures 16 square cubits (28 m2). The transaction was concluded before (ana mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilia). 4 witnesses (including Nergal-ēṭir, Šāpik-zēri and Nabû-ušabši of the Iddin-Papsukkal Family and Lâbâši of the Ilūtu-bāni Family) and the scribe (of the Iddin-Papsukkal Family), also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A1 = Zākiru//Iddin-Papsukkal; A2 = Bābilāya//Iddin-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Ilūtu-bāni; C = Iddin-ahu//Ilūta-bāni; Scribe = Bēl-lē’i//Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute: A accused B to have in use his property. Their case has been brought before and decided by C and the citizens of Dilbat: B has to pay to A 10 shekels of silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mannu-kī-šarri; B = Upāqu; C = Bēl-ēpuš; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Sēkiru

elementText.text:
Retroact of a purchase of a date garden: In Kandalānu 9th year A purchases a date garden for ½ mina and 3 shekels of silver from B who, on his part, has previously purchased the garden from fC2 and her two sons C3 and C4 in Šamaš-šumu-ukīn 20th year. It is the inheritance share (zittu) of C1, deceased husband of fC2, and C2, brother of C1. The garden is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Dūru-ša-Šulāya, in the district (pīhatu) Al-Kaldu, at the Balāssu Canal (Nāru-ša-Balāssu). It borders on land which A received from D. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Bammāya//Egibi; B = Bēl-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Rab-banê; C1 = Rāši-ili/Bēl-zēri//Egibi; fC2 = fŠusitu, wife of C1; C3 = Arad-Bēl, son of C1; C4 = Nabû-zēru-ibni, son of C1; C5 = Bābu-iddin/Bēl-zēri//Egibi, brother of C1; D = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Bābu-iddin; Scribe = Nergal-[…]/Ahu-šubši//Eppēš-ilī

elementText.text:
Purchase of land: A purchases from the brothers B1 and B2 4 furrows (šer’u) of land for 6 shekels of silver. The sold land is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Mušēzib-Uraš which forms part of the hanšû-land of Balāṭu/Nummuru and borders on the Šatammu Canal (Harru-ša-Šatammi). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Uraš-šumu-iddin; B1 = Ea-bāni//Bā’iru; B2 = Nabû-ahu-ēreš/Bā’iru; Scribe = Kudurru

elementText.text:
Agreement concerning the redemption (of debt) by means of the transfer of slaves: In the end of the following month, that is, Nisān (I), B will bring along and give (abāku-nadānu) the people (amīlūtu) to A. In case A agrees and takes them (abāku), B pays 1/3 shekel of silver to A. In case A does not agree and does not take them, B pays 2/3 mina and 5 shekels of silver to A. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-īpuš; B = Upāqu; Scribe = Bēlšunu//Bēliā’u

elementText.text:
Loan of a woman: C, daughter of B, is at the disposal of (ina pāni) A1 and A2 for a yearly payment of 2 TÚG.UB.RA garments to Ištar of Uruk and Nanāya. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) of Eanna (Šamaš-ṣillāya). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iqīšāya/Marduk-šarrāni; A2 = Ṣillāya/Eanna-ibni; B = Eanna-ibni, father of C; C = Ilat, daughter of B; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šumāya

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 2 days, from the 9th to the 10th of Abu (IV) of the following year, for 39 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 7 witnesses  and the scribe. The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Marduk-zēru-ibni/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ahhēa

A = Bēl-ušallim; B = Rēmūtu; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-ibni/[…]

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of one talbultu-garment, from B1. The purchase price corresponds to the claim (rašûtu) towards B2, the father of the seller, and, hence, is in fact not handed over; instead the garden serves as compensation. The transferred garden is located in the district (erṣetu) of the royal canal (nār šarri) in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1, its lower side on (the property of) C2 and its lower front on hanšû-land. Its upper front, which measures 230 cubits (115 m), follows the royal canal (nār šarri). No cardinal directions are given in the record. 17 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. . The same type of procedure is recorded in BM118982.
 
A = Bēl-ibni/Šamaš-īpuš; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Ahhē; B2 = Ahhēa/Zabdānu; C1 = Balāṭu/Nabû-nāṣir; C2 = Nabû-lēˀi/Marduk; Scribe = Kidin-Marduk//(Ša)-rēš-ummāni

elementText.text:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 4 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B1. The sold house is the property of B2 whose relation to B1 remains unclear, and is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) borders on a dead-end street (sūqu lā āṣû) as well as the house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the house of C2 and its lower front (in the east) on the house(s) belonging to C1 and C3. No side lengths are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya). 8 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Iddin-Marduk//Šumāya; B2 = Dumqāya/Šullumāya; C1 = Huddāya/Kukul; C2 = Kīnāya/Nādin-aplu; C3 = Nabû-šumu-ušarši/Ahhūtu; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-iqīša//Dayyānu

elementText.text: List of offerings, possibly for the Šamaš Temple in Sippar: Pubescent bulls (alpu šuklulu), grown-up sheep (udgallu), young bulls (alpu bīru), yearlings (mār šatti), lambs (puhādu), ducks (paspasu) and TU.KIL-doves are provided for the gods Šamaš, Aya, Marduk, Ṣarpanītu, Bunene, Bēlit-Sippar, Anu, Enlil, Adad, Bēlit-[…], Anunītu and Bēlit-[…].

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning an adoption of a daughter: A1 and fA2, wife of A1, approach B1 and fB2 and ask them to adopt out and give them their daughter fC. B1 grants the request and entrusts fC. A1 voluntarily gives a TÚG.KUR.RA garment and a šir’am-garment, as an additional payment, to B1 and fB2. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Šamaš-uṣur//Ṣillāya; fA2 = fKidinnīti, wife of A1; B1 = Ninurta-iddin; fB2 = fLū-bēlti, wife of B1; fC = fAkkaiti; Scribe = Ahu-lūmur//Bēlšunu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 2/3 minas of silver. B will give the silver at the end of the month Ulūl (VI), that is, within half a year. If he fails to do so, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 2 shekels (40% p.a.). 6 witnesses (including Aššūr-ilāˀī, tašlīšu [third man] and Quqû, sēpiru [alphabetic scribe]) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahu-iddin; B = Murānu; Scribe = Imbāya//Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Redemption of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): A1, A2 and A3 redeem (paṭāru) from B his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ninurta-uballiṭ /Bēl-usātu; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Danni-Nergal; B = Nabû-ahu-uṣur; fC = fEṭirtu

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 1 5/6 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from the brothers B1 and B2. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of É.LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside Nippur. Its upper side (in the north), its lower side (in the south) and its upper front (in the east) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front (in the west) borders on the street (sūqu). It measures [x] x 25 cubits ([x] x 12.5 m). 38(+) witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of seal impressions (kunukku), fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of B1 and B2.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahu-ušbši; B1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Nabû-ahhē-erība; B2 = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-erība; C1 = Nabû-iqīša//Bēl-iddin; C2 = Bēl-zēri//Zēru-ibni; C3 = Ahhēšāya//Dummuqu; Scribe = Lā-qēpu//Ēa-īpuš

elementText.text:
Administrative document dealing with the redistribution of tax income in the form of emmer beer: In sum 0;1.0.6  kor (42 l) of first quality (rēštu) emmer beer (kunāšu) of tax income (nisihtu) are given out under the supervision of (ša qātē) of A. In detail: 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) from B1 to the women fC1 and fC2 on the 3rd, 4th and 5th day of Šabāṭ (XI), 0;0.0.24 kor (24 l) from B2 to C3 on the 4th day of Šabāṭ (XI), 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) from B3 to C4 on the 5th day of Šabāṭ (XI) and 0;0.0.6 kor (6 l) from B1 for drink (ana šatê) to the women of the palace (sinništu ša ekalli) on the 6th day Šabāṭ (XI).
 
A = Akbāru; B1 = Nabû-dīnī-ēpuš; B2 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B3 = Nabû-mukīn-ahi; fC1 = Atkî-ili; fC2 = Išipta’; C3 = Barāqā; C4 = Nabû-ana-kâša-atkal

elementText.text:
Dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning a house: The brothers B1, B2 and B3 approach the brothers A1 and A2 concerning the house of their father which has been destroyed when their father was guarantor for C1. A1 and A2 do not agree and reply that C2, son of C1, has declared the claim for invalid. Instead of a legal proceeding, A1 and A2 agree to pay 7.5 minas of silver to B1, B2 and B3, provided that there is no further claim. Guarantee clauses. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Šumu-ukīn/Kudurru; A2 = Šākin-šumi/Kudurru; B1 = Nādin-ahi/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; B2 = Nabû-ušallim/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; B3 = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; C1 = Nabû-zēru-ušabši; C2 = Mušallim-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-ušabši

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share of the prebend of the butcher (ṭābihūtu) in Esangila for 2 days in the month Kislīm (IX) for 53 shekels of silver from B. 15 witnesses and the scribe, specified as writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).

A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Nūrea; Scribe = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Mudammiq-Adad

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 3 days, from the 16th to the 18th of Simān (III) of the following year, for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 4 witnesses  and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). The transaction takes place in the 4th year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Ṭubbušu/Bēlšunu; Scribe = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Zākiru

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu) of a business partnership. The debt is free of interest (hubuttūtu) until the midst of Nisān (I) of the following year (Ššu 19). If B fails to pay by then, the amount of silver will be added to the sum A invested in the same business partnership (harrānu). 1 square kor of arable land (zēru) of B, located beneath the Canal (harru) of Ahhē-šullim, as well as 294+ square cubits (c. 73.5 m2) of the house of B are placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses (including Nabû-gāmil and his son Nādinu of the Ṭābihu family) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Bēl-nāṣir//Ṭābihu; Scribe = Nabû-nāṣir/[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes ½ mina of silver to A. The debt will bear an interest of 1/5 (hummušu) shekel of silver per shekel (20% p.a). 3 witnesses (including Nergal-nāṣir//Nabû-ahu-ēreš) and the scribe.
 
A = Ahu-umma-aqar//Lā-qīpu; B = Ilāya//Nabû-ahu-ēreš; Scribe = Ninurta-nāṣir//Lā-qīpu

elementText.text:
Transfer of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): fB voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sells the young woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC1, in the presence of her mother fC2, to A1, A2 and A3 for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. fC1 is handed over – there will be no retracting among them. fB, fC2 and D and guarantee (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC1. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nergal; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Ninurta-uballiṭ; fB = fAhatu; fC1 = fdIM.ZU.AN.NA-en-qit; fC2 = fIna-Nippur-bēlit; D = Iddin-ahu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A1 3 ½ minas of silver. The debt is secured by the pledge of the garden of B, which is located between the cities of Kiš and Hursag-kalamma and borders on (the property of) C. Since A2, son of A1, has given the promissory note (uˀiltu) at the expense of (ša muhhi) the debtor B, in replacement of the purchase price of 1 mina and 14 shekels of silver to D, B shall pay the silver to D. 11 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ahhūtu//Dannēa; A2 = Šumu-iddin/Ahhūtu//Dannēa; B = Bābu-iddin/Ahhē-iddin; C = Mušibši; D = Šarēdu/Bābia; Scribe = Zākiru/Bēl-lēˀu//Irˀanni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe to A 3 kor (540 l) of dates without interest (qaqqadu). They will pay the dates in the month Kislīm (IX). They mutually guarantee (pūtu našû) for the payment of the debt. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-bēl-ili//Ibni-ili; B1 = Nabû-gāmil//Aqar-Nabû; B2 = Nabû-nāṣir//Naggāru; Scribe = Nabû-mudammiq//Ilūšu-abišu

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 10 shekels of silver from B2, who acts on behalf of the wife of the deceased B1. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside of Nippur. Its upper side (in the north) borders on a house of A and its upper front (in the west) on the house of C. Its lower side (in the south) and its lower front (in the east) border on the plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). It measures 31 x 2 cubits (15.5 x 1 m). 13 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Bulluṭu//Bēl-rībi; B1 = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahu-dannu; B2 = Bulluṭu//Zēria; C = Amāssu-ul-tēnnu//Rēmūtu; Scribe = Naram-Sîn//Nabû-ahhē-iddin

A = Nergal-ušallim; B = Bābu-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun

elementText.text:
Broken dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning small livestock: According to this fragmentary record 38 small livestock animals must be brought to the bishop (šatammu). In case the accused fails to do so, he has to pay 2 minas of silver. 5 witnesses and the scribe, specified as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir u’ilti) and bearing the title “scribe of Eanna.”
 
Scribe = Širikti-Marduk/Ibni-Ištar, scribe of Eanna

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 3 days, from the 3rd to the 5th of Simān (III) of the following year, for 5/6 mina of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 2 witnesses  and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Ṭubbušu/Bēlšunu; Scribe = Naˀid-Marduk/Iddin-Nabû

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute concerning a pledged house: Law case concerning a house which C2, the guarantor (māhiṣ pūti), has pledged to B1, creditor in an interest-bearing loan (hubullānu) of 2 minas of silver, to C1, the brother of C2. When B2, the son of B1, on the basis of a sealed document (ṭuppu kī kanāku), claims his rights on the said house, A asserts that the house was already pledged to him. Following the decision of the assembly (puhru) of the Babylonians and the governor (šākin ṭēmi), A paid the 2 minas of silver to B2 and in return received a sealed document (kunukku). Now, the house, as a pledge, is only at the disposal of A. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Kunāya//Basia; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir (A)/Kunāya/Basia; C1 = Šulāya//Ṭābia; C2 = Nabû-ēṭir (B)//Ṭābia; Scribe = Marduk-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad

elementText.text:
Manumission of an (temporarily) unfree individual: A redeems (paṭāru) C from B for 1 mina and 4 shekels of silver. B guarantees against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu). 7 witnesses (including Naṭeru, man from Ru’a) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahu-iddin; B = Šumāya; C = Ina-ṣilli-Nusku; Scribe = Šamaš-erība

elementText.text:
Redemption of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): A1, A2 and A3 redeem (paṭāru) from fB her small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. fB guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC1. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ninurta-uballiṭ/Bēl-usāti; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Danni-Nergal; fB = Bau-asīti/Šamaš-iddin; fC = Tuqnīti

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning a self-adoption (during times of siege): The first 5 lines of the tablet are broken. The preserved text starts with the approach of fB towards A, who asks A to feed her and take her as his slave. A grants the request and determines her maintenance costs (kurummatu). In case her husband, her son, her brother or another relative would like to redeem (paṭāru) fB, he has to replace her in equal terms. Curse formula. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Aplāya//Šangû-Sippar; fB = fMaqartu; Scribe = Šākin-šumi//Ša-nāšišu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: 1 1/2 mina of silver belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The debtor will pay the capital sum (qaqqudu) of the debt at the opening of the gate (ina petî bābi). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-ušallim//Nabû-useppi; B = Ninurta-gāmil//Aplāya; Scribe = Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Rabû-zēru-ibni

elementText.text:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 9 ½ shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gula Gate inside Nippur. Its upper side (in the north), with a street (sūqu) lying inbetween (ina bīrišunu), borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side (in the south) on (the property of) C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the Šalla Canal and its lower front (in the west) on (the property of) the seller B, which is a plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). It measures 24 x 6 cubits (12 x 3 m). 7 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Also fD is present at the sealing and receives 3 shekels of silver. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Enlil-ibni//Nabû-bāna; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Dābibī; C1 = Lâbâši//Katirru; C2 = Šāpiku//Banāya; fD = fŠa-bullat/Šumu-uṣur; Scribe = Nabû-nāˀid//Damiqia

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases 3 square kor (40,500 m2) of garden for 2 minas and 26 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment of 3 kor (540 l) of dates and a TÚG.KUR.RA garment (cover [kuttumu] for women), from B1. The garden is located at the Šamaš Gate of Dilbat and borders on the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal), the New Wall of Dilbat (dūru eššu ša Dilbat) and the property of C. The silver was given to D, creditor of B2. 9 witnesses and scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bammāya//Egibi; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Lâbâši//Basia, son of B2; B2 = Lâbâši//Basia, father of B1; C = Kudurru/Bēl-ēṭir/Šangû-Dilbat; D = Šullumu/Kunāya; Scribe = Etellu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:

A = Kalbi/Nūrea; B = Nādin/Lagamal-ēṭir; C = Iddināya/Ēppeš-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Sēkiru

elementText.text:
Exchange of date gardens: A and B exchange their date gardens with each other. B receives 0;1 square kor (2,700 m2) cultivated date garden which is located at the Lagamal Canal and borders on (the property of) C. A receives 0;1.3 square kor (4,050 m2) cultivated date garden. In case of breach of contract, the fine is 2 minas of silver. 8 witnesses and the scribe, also described as writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A = Ea-ibni/Bēl-lēˀi; B = Ṣillāya/Erība/Šangû-Dilbat; C = Šāpik-zēri/Bammāya/Egibi; Scribe = Lagamal-ušabši/Šangû-Dilbat

elementText.text:
Lease of a prebend: B rents out to A [x] days, the remainder ([  b]?-ab-ti) of ten days, of the prebend of the brewer (sirāšūtu). C, brother of B, is guarantor. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a share of the prebend of the temple enterer (ērib bītūti) of B and C. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir/Bānia; B = Ṣillāya/Ir’anni; C = Aplāya/Ir’anni; Scribe = Tabnēa/Balīhu

elementText.text:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for half of the 1st day of Simān (III) of the following year for 6 ½ shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of ¼ shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 2 witnesses  and the scribe. The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) (of the seller).
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Lâbâši/Gudādû; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Kudurru

Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina and 6 shekel of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of [x] shekels per mina. The field (eqlu) of B, situated beneath the Canal of the Mulberry (harru ša ṣarbi), is placed as a pledge. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Aqarâ//Šangû-Enamtila; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni//Sîn-tabni

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases an orchard (kirû) for 3 minas and 50 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 15 shekels of silver, from B. The sold orchard is the 1/6 (inheritance) share (zittu) which B2, the father of the seller, received from B3, the grandfather of the seller. It is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front border on (the properties of) C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front border on the royal canal (nār šarri). Neither cardinal directions nor measures are given for the sides of the plot. 11 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B1. In YBC11413 we learn about two other 1/6 shares of the inheritance of Ahhēa.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Ibnāya/Ṭābia; B2 = Ibnāya/Ahhēa/Ṭābia; B3 = Ahhēa/Aplāya/Ṭābia; C1 = Kudurru//Nabû-naˀid; C2 = Nādinu//Ērešu; C3 = Pirˀu//Bēl-useppi; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-ēreš/Šāpiku/Atkuppu

elementText.text:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a half share (ahu) of a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 ½ minas of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 shekels of silver, from B1 and B2 (B1’s mother). The sold garden belongs to B3 (the [deceased] father of B1) and is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on the city wall (dūr āli), its lower side on the house of C1, its upper front on the street (sūqu) and its lower front on (the property of) C2. No cardinal directions are given in the record. Its upper side measures 300 cubits (150 m), its lower side and upper front 240 cubits (120 m) and its lower front 190 cubits (95 m). The plot presumably is the second half of the land bought by A from B1 and B2 one year earlier (BM118979). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Balāṭu). 14 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; B2 = Nasqat; B3 = Kudurru/Nabû-ahu-ēreš; C1 = Zākiru, aškāpu (leatherworker); C2 = Zibāya//Šangû-Ninurta; Scribe = Bēl-īpuš//Šamaš-bāri

elementText.text:
Exchange of land: A receives from B 0;2 square kor (5,400 m2) of arable land (zēru) forming part of the hanšû-land of C1. Its upper side and its lower side border on (property already owned by) A. Furthermore, the upper side as well as the upper front border on a plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). The lower side also borders on the marsh (raqqatu) of Aṣūnu. In exchange for his land, B receives 20 shares of hanšû-land of C2 located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Guraˀbi. The transaction is concluded before (ina mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilia) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal). Though no titles are given along the two individuals, their identification as governor and bishop respectively is clear. 5 witnesses (including Arad-Sutīti, the father of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Puhhuru/Arad-Sutīti//Ilūtu-bāni; B = Marduk-šarrāni//Ilia, šāpir sirāšāni (overseer of the brewers); C1= Bēlšunu//Da[…]; C2 = Supê-Bēl//Ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šākin-šumi//Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti

elementText.text:
Purchase of a share of hanšu-land: (During times of hardship) A purchases one half share (mišli zitti) of hanšu-land belonging to C for 12 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B1 and B2. The sold land reaches from the Old Canal to the dyke (kilâtu). The measured area (mišihtu) of its ditch (sūru) beneath (šupālu) the town of Bēl-iqbi is 13 square cubits (22.75 m2). The transaction is concluded in the presence of the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Iliya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal). The main part of the witness list together with the date and other possible text parts are broken. The few names preserved from the witness list are incomplete and described as “broken” (hepû).

A = Arad-Sutīti//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Zākiru//Iddin-Papsukkal; B2 = Raši-ili//Iddin-Papsukkal; C = Nādin-ahi//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Purchase of land: A purchases 0;0.0.2 square kor (150 m2) arable land (zēru) for 3 ¾ shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) from B. The sold land is located within the (area of the) Old Canal (nāru labīru) at the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) and belongs to the ḫanšû-land of C. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front border on (property already owned by) the buyer. Its upper front borders on (the property of) D. The transaction is concluded before (ana mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-zēru-līšir//Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Zēr-Bābili//Nūr-Papsukkal). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-iddin, another member of the Ilūtu-bāni Family and Mār-bīti-ili, another member of the Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti Family) and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Puhhuru//Ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-lēˀi/Tabnēa/Ilūtu-bāni; C = Illûa//Ilūtu-bāni; D = Balāṭu; Scribe = Nabû-mušēzib//Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Purchase of a date garden: A purchases from B 0;0.2 square kor (900 m2) of arable land (zēru), a garden planted with date palms (kirî gišimmarē zaqpu), for 1 mina of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 kor (360 l) of barley. The sold garden is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) in the hanšû-land of Supē-Bēl//Ilūtu-bāni. Its upper side and its upper front border on (the properties of) A and its lower front on (the property of) C.  Its lower side borders on up-hi (mng. unknown). At the sealing (kanāku) of the sealed document (kunukku) were present the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Marduk-nāṣir//Nūr-Papsukkal) and the enterer of the Nabû Temple (ērib bīt Nabû) and bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-aplu-iddin//Nūr-Papsukkal) as well as witnesses 2 (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni and Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Bēl-lē’i//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe and writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Instead of a seal impression, fingernail impression of the seller.
 
A = Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Bēl-ahhē-erība//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Šamaš- erība //(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Šabru

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe A1 and A2 29 kor (5,220 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the field, dowry (nudunnû) of fC. They will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. They will also give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). This is apart from (elat) the claim (rašûtu) of A1 due from (ina muhhi) B2. Witnesses and the scribe. The wages in dates (sissinnu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Iddināya/Nabû-ēreš/Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Rēmūtu/Mušallim-Marduk; B2 = Iddināya/Balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; fC = name lost; Scribe = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Gula-šum-ibni/[…]

It refers to 20 shares (zittu) on hanšû-land of B held by the brothers B1, B2, B3 and B4. 4+ witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B1.

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe fA 31? kor (5,580 l) of dates, impost (imittu), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli). They will pay the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in the house of fA. They will also give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). The wages in dates (sissinnu) and (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). Witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia, wife of […]/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B1 = […]/ Dādia; B2 = Iddin-Bēl/Bānia//Banê-ša-ilia; Scribe = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iddin

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes to the brothers A1 and A2 35 kor (6,300 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the land bordering the ditch (harru) of Bīt-Apkallu. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki). He will also give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). The payment for the wages in dates (sissinnu) has not yet been assigned (nasāku Stat.). This is apart from (elat) 2 date palms (gišimmaru). Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nergal-ušēzib//Šēp-llia; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

The payment is for the period from [x] month of Darius 26th year to the end of Arahsamna (VIII) of Darius of the same year. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = […]/Mušēzib-Bēl//Zērūtu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ibni//Nanāhu; C = Nabû-kāṣir, gugallu (agriculturual supervisor) of Borsippa, D = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu

elementText.text:
Balancing of debts: Dates, impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru), field in Sūr-amēlāti, dowry estate (bīt nudunnî) of fA, which are due from B1, are set off against (kūm) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 5 beer vats, ½ shekels of silver and 5 kor (900 l) of dates which fA owes to B2, father of B1. B1 divides (zâzu) with fA: fA is paid (eṭēru Stat.) by B1 the dates according to (akî) (the remainder) of her promissory note. B1 will work (epēšu) the arable land (zēru) except for (elat) 0;2 square kor (5,400 m2) of land and fA will give wages in dates (sissinnu). fA will give the remainder (rēhu) of 1;2 kor (252 l) of dates of B1, without interest (hubullu), in Tašrīt (VII) of Cambyses 2nd year. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fKabtāya/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni; B1 =  Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Ninurta; B2 = Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Ninurta; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Šulāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Agreement concerning the payment of gold: Until 20th Addar (XII) B will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) to A 22 shekels 7/10 gold by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. If B does not do so, he will return the capital sum (qaqqadu) of the gold and hand it over (târu D-stem-nadānu) to A. 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Zēr-Bābili/Šūzubu//Nappāhu; B = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Agreement over the watch of a canal: B will push (abāku) the water from the drain channel (ārittu) of A. He will keep watch (naṣāru) over the lock (mušēlû; mu-te-le-e) of the sluice (pirku) of the Old Canal. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against A’s loss (mīṭu) of water – he won’t use (akālu) it. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-kāṣir//Nūr-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun; Scribe = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk//Ilia

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 14 kor (2,520 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Bīt-Zēr-Ibnāya, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. B will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure of A, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). For each kor he will give one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and [...]. 2 witnesses and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) the previous claim (rašûtu) charged against (ina muhhi) B.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Arad-Nabû//Ibnāya;  Scribe = Ezida-šumu-ibni/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

A commodity (lost) is placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses (including Ina-ṣilli-Bēl/Nabû-ušallim, oblate of Nabû [širik Nabû]) and the scribe.
 
fA = fUbārtu/Nabûnnāya//Nabû-šumu-ibni; fB = fBēlilītu/Nabû-ēreš//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Murānu/Mušallim-Marduk//Kidin-Nabû

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 3;3 kor (648 l) of barley, without interest (qaqqadu). They will pay the dates in Borsippa without interest (hubullu) at the end of Simān (III) according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-uṣur-inu’, slave [qallu] of Zēr-Bābili) and the scribe. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû).
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Iṣṣur/Nabû-kāṣir; fB2 = fBazītu; Scribe = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Bēlšunu//Rē’ânu

elementText.text:
Lease of a house: Beginning with the 15th of the present month A rents out to B for 4 years a house adjoining the house of C for 6 shekels of silver rent per year. The tenant is responsible for the renewing of the north wing (bīt ištāni) until Tašrīt (VII). The costs for it will be covered by the rent (idū) of the house. For any other work he performs (epēšu) in the house, the tenant can withhold (kalû D-stem) the expenditure (tēlītu) and charge (manû) his landlord with it. At the sealing of the tablet (ṭuppu) 2 witnesses (including Kidin-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Eppēš-ilī) and the scribe. Broken additional clause about the access of the landlord to the house.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Silim-Bēl/Šumāya//Eppeš-ilī; C = Rēmūtu/Ša-pî-Bēl//Kānik-bābi; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-libši

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: The brothers B1 and B2 owe A 3+ minas of silver by 1/12 alloy per shekel (1 šiqil girê) and 1 mina of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). The loan will bear an (yearly) interest (hubullu) of 6 shekels of silver per mina (10% p.a.) to be paid on a monthly basis. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 1 witness (Nādinu/Nabû-iqbi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Nabû-šumu-ēreš//Nūr-Papsukkal; B1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni//Huṣābu

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute: B1 will bring along (abāku) fC until the 5th Arahsamna. He mutually put an end to his argument (dibbu qatû D-stem) with A concerning the compensation payment (mandattu). If B1 does not bring fC, he will give A 0;0.1 kor (6 l) flour (qēmu) per day as compensation payment of fC. A will pay B1 1 kor (180 l) of dates of the harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of fB2, wife of B1, which is the remainder (rēhu) at the disposal of (ina pāni) A. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Gimillu//Ibnāya; fB2 = fAmat-Sutīti; fC = fNanāya-ittia; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir/Mār-bīti-iddin//Raksu

B2, father of B1, guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the debts. 2 witnesses and the scribe; a third witness is added after the date formula.
 
A = Bunnānu/Mār-bīti-ušallim//Mudammiq-Nabû; B1 = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ilī-bāni; B2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ilī-bāni, father of B1; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Pa-ŠIH

elementText.text:
Transfer of property: B1, B2, B3 and B4 agreed to transfer under seal (kanāku) and give to A a half share (ahu) in the domain of C against payment of 1/3 shekel of silver per 0;0.1 square kor (450 m2) of land. If they decide (ṭâbu+libbu, iṭ-ṭib-bu-ú-ma) to let A take possession (târu D) of the domain, they will give it to him for the agreed-upon purchase price  (šīmu). If they decide not to turn over the domain, they will bring the 1 mina of silver which A has given for the agreement (ṭābūtu; ṭàb-bu-ú-(nu-)ti). In the presence (ina ušuzzi) of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Aplāya//Kidin-Sîn; B2 = Iqišāya, son of Maqartu; B3 = Arad-Sutīti//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B4 = Šumu-ukīn//Munnabittu; C = Balāssu/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nergal-iddin//Kidin-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment: A receives in full (mahāru-eṭēru) from B 1/3 shekels of silver, remainder (rēhtu) of (the amount of the) exchange (šupêltu) of his arable land (zēru), according to (akî) his promissory note (u’iltu) due from (ina muhhi) B. Until the 17th of the month [x] A will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) the promissory note to B. 3 witnesses and the scribe as well as another witness at the end of the document.
 
A = Iqīša-Marduk/Šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//KAL-AŠ

elementText.text:
Lease of a storeroom: Beginning with the 12th (of Arahsamna) A rents out to B the storeroom (bīt qātē) of the bīt asuppi building for the yearly rent (idū) of 2 shekels of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. B shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the other half share in the middle of the year. B will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the wall (asurrû) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). He will give the daily (gift) of Enlil, the kīnayātu-gift and a date palm product (šugarrû). Broken section. 1+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-lū-šallim, širik Nabû (oblate of Nabû); Scribe = Mušēzib-Bēl/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ša-nāšišu

He will give the dates in their entirety in Tašrīt (VII) in Borsippa, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. For 1 kor of dates he will also give a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). This is apart from (elat) the previous credit (rašûtu) concerning 1 kor of dates. 2 witnesses (Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Marduk-zēru-ibni//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.

elementText.text:

Broken passage and another broken passage saying that […] received from B and B received in full (mahāru-eṭēru) from A. 3 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). Each party has taken a copy. Another broken clause.
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Bēl-ēṭir//Nanāhu; C = Nabû-zēru-ukīn/Nādinu//Raksu; D = Ṣillāya; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Egibi

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: fB1 and B2 owe the brothers A1 and A2 27 kor (4,860 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru) of the hanšu-land of Bīt-Ea-ilūtu-bāni. B1 and B2 will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. For each kor they will give one load (of palm-frond ribs), date palm fibres (mangagu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 2 witnesses and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory notes (u’iltu).
 
A1 = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Dādia/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fB1 = fBurāšu, wife of Iddia; B2 = Mār-bīti-ēreš/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Pappāya; Scribe = Širiktu/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Naggāru

The field is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) and adjoining (the house of) C. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fB = fBusasa/Bēl-uballiṭ//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Šamaš-iddin/Šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; D = Nabû-nūr-ka-lūmur/Nabû-nāṣir/Nūr-Sîn; Scribe = Nabû-aplu-iddin/[…]//Rabûtu-ša-Adad

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 2 kor (360 l) of dates. He will pay the entire amount of dates in Borsippa in Arahsamna (VIII). 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Ea-ilūtu-bāni and Nūr-Šamaš, oblate of Nabû [širik Nabû]) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-šuzibanni, qallu (slave) of Zēr-Bābili, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A [x] kor of barley. He will give the barley in its entirety in Simān (III), together with interest (hubullu) of 0;1 kor (36 l) per 1 kor (180 l) of barley (20% p.a.), that is, 28;2 kor (5,472 l) of barley, according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. The barley for the house of C is paid. 2 witnesses (including […]/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Zēru-[…]//[…]; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; C = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya; Scribe = Nabû-šākin-šulum/[…]//Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 30 kor (5,400 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), according to the measure of A, in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Sūr-Amēlāti. For each kor of dates B gives one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). The wages in dates (sissinnu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugulla) are paid (eṭēru Stat.). Apart from (elat) this transaction 2 kor (360 l) of dates are paid. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ēṭir/Marduk-nāṣir//Šangû-Inurta; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Kabtāya//Nabû-šēme

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and fB2 owe A 20 kor (3,600 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Sūr-Amēlāti. They will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in the irrigation district Sūr-Amēlāti bordering the [...] Canal. They will also give 15 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) in Borsippa. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 3 witnesses (including Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Ninurta-iddin/Zēria; fB2 = fLē’ītu, wife of Nabû-rēme-šukun; Scribe = Nabû-[…]/[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and the daughter of B2 owe A1 and fA2 24 kor (4,320 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) which borders on the ditch (harru) of Bīt-Apkallu. They will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in the house of A1, according to the measure of 1 pānu of the king, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). With each kor of dates he will also give a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). This is apart from (elat) two date palms (gišimmaru). 2 witnesses (including Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Šumu-nāṣir//Ilī-bāni; B2 = […]/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Šu[…]; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-nādin-ahi//Eppēš-ilī

elementText.text:
Receipt of flour and barley: A, on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, receives flour (qēmu) and barley (details lost) from B. As much barley as is the share (zittu) of C, according to (akî) the bow-service (qatû) in Borsippa, A will give it to B. 5 witnesses (including Bēl-uballiṭ/Rēmūt-Nabû//Iddin-Papsukkal) and the scribe. Two more individuals, presumably witnesses, are mentioned at the end of the tablet.
 
A = Bēl-māru-ka/[…]//Iddin-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Kalbāya//Nanāhu; C = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; Scribe = Nabû-mutarriṣ/Marduk-ušallim//Kidin-Sîn

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: For 1 square kor (13,500 m2) of arable land (zēru) B1 and B2 owe A 63 kor (11,340 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru) of the Garden (kirû) of Sūhaya. B1 and B2 will give the dates in their entirety at the Gate of the Warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure (mašīhu) of A, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). Their wages in dates (sissinnu) are included. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B1 = Nergal-zēru-ibni/Nabû-[…]//Banê-ša-ilia; B2 = Nabû-lē’i/Marduk//Atkuppu; Scribe = Nabû-dābib-šunu/Nabû-ušallim//Ša-haṭṭi-ēreš

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe the siblings fA1 and A2 50 shekels of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). The house of B1, which borders the house of C and […] Eanna, is placed as a pledge. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). 8 years they will dwell in the house. They will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the walls (asurrû) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). If the costs for the work they perform (dullu epēšu) and for the bricks (libittu), reed (qanû) and beams (gušūru) make less than ¼ (shekels) of silver, they will charge (manû) B1 with the expenses. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay (šalāmu D-stem) 5 shekels of silver. 2 witnesses and the scribe. The contract was drawn up in the presence of (ina ašābi) fB3, mother of B1.
 
fA1 = fNināya/Nabû-ušallim//[…]; A2 = Šamaš-uballiṭ/Nabû-ušallim//[…]; B1 = Iddināya/Nabû-ēreš//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B2 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fB3 = fHubbuṣītu, mother of B1; Scribe = Nabû-napšātu-uṣur/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Delivery note: B delivered 69+ kiln-fired bricks (agurru) together with 2 granaries (natbaku) at the harbour (kāru) and kiln-fired bricks of A until the 14th of Tašrīt (VII). The bricks are for performing (epēšu) work of the harbour at the Giššu Gate. The accounts are drawn up (nikkassu epēšu).
 
A = Amurru-abiši; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru

elementText.text:
Receipt of dates: A, on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, receives 63 kor (11,340 l) of dates from B by boat. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Anu-ahu-iddin/Kalbāya; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Bēl-ahhē-iqīša/Šamaš-ahhē-uṣur//Naggāru; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Naggāru

element.description: Year for sorting purposes

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 12;0.4 kor (2,184 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in the house of A, according to the measure of the king. He will also give 20 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 20 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). The wages in dates (sissinnu) and the (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses (including Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) 3 date palms (gišimmaru). 2 kor of dates of B at the expense of A are paid. B will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) to A the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 5+ kor and 4 kor of dates.  
 
A = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Šumu-nāṣir//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-[iqbi]/Marduk-erība//[…]

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley: A, on behalf of (ina našparti) fC, receives from B1 and B2 in sum 7;4 kor (1,404 l) of barley, rations (kurummatu) of fC until the end of Tašrīt (VII) Nabonidus 10th year. The sum of barley includes 4 kor (720 l) of barley, rations of Abu (V) and Ulūl (VI), and 3;4 kor (580 l) of barley, rations of Ulūl (VI) – a second time – and  Tašrīt (VII), apart from (elat) 0;1 kor which was taken by by fD. There are no witnesses and no scribe mentioned.
 
A = Mušēzib/Zēr-Bābili; B1 = Nabû-iddin; B2 = Nabû-kāšir; fC = fMiṣātu; fD = fAndia

elementText.text:
Pledge of land: A takes from (ina qātē) B as a pledge 6 square reeds (73.5 m2) of land (erṣetu) of the Namtar Temple in the centre of Borsippa for 1/3 mina of silver. The land is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). A will give the silver to B. Broken passage referring to a promissory note (u’iltu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēlšunu/Balāssu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-nādin-ahi//Gahal

elementText.text:
Sale of a donkey: A receives from B a 9-year old donkey for 9 shekels of silver by order of (ina našparti) C. The silver is given by C. 2 witnesses (Balāṭu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Nūr-Papsukkal and Lâbâši/Nabû-ēṭir//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ittannu/Šumāya//Nūr-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-erība/Nergal-rēṣūa, širik Nabû (oblate of Nabû); C = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Nūr-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Sale of two men: B sells C1 and C2 for 12 1/3 minas of silver to A. In case there are transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu), B will return the slaves and hand them over (târu D-stem-nadānu) to A. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; B = Ilī-bāni/Nabû-lē’i//Ilī-bāni; C1 = Dunānu; C2 = Nabû-kullimanni; Scribe = Nabû-šāpik-zēri/Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A1 and A2 3 kor (540 l) of barley, šibšu-tax of the field of the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Halat, bordering a date garden (kirû gišimmaru) in the city of Šaddinnu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi, which is not yet divided (zâzu) with the uncles (names lost) of A1 and A2. He will pay the barley in its entirety in Simān (III) in Borsippa in the house of A1 and A2. In addition he will give 2/3 bundle (makṣaru) of straw (tibnu). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is paid (eṭēru Stat.). This is apart from (elat) the overdue promissory note (u’iltu ša adanni) of A2 due from (ina muhhi) B. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-mukīn-zēri; A2 = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi; B = Nabû-ēṭir/Bazuzu//[…]āya; Scribe = Nabû-iqīša/Nabû-[…]//Maqartu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes in sum 16 kor (2,880 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru) of A. B will give the dates in their entirety in Tašrīt (VII) at the Gate of the Warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure (mašīhu) of [...]. He will also give 16 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) as well as 100 date palm fibres (mangagu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-ušallim//Bēl-ibni; B = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-ibni//Kidin-Nanāya; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-ušebši/Nabû-lē’i//Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes his brother A 55 shekels of silver. fC, female slave (qallatu) of B, is placed as a pledge. Broken clause about the payment of B. 2 witnesses (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni and Nādinu/Nabû-kāṣir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. For each day fC falls ill (marāṣu) or disappears (halāqu), B will pay (šalāmu D-stem) 0;0.4 kor (24 l) of barley as compensation payment (mandattu).
 
A = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fC = fNuhānu; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Šulāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Transfer of property: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) transmits under seal (dagālu Š-stem-kanāku) to his wife fA 49 square cubits (85.75 m2) of land (qaqqaru) with its front being cultivated land (bītu mērešu). The transferred property is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Qutānu and in the hanšû-land of Bīt-Ilūtu-bāni. It ranges from the front of the Canal of the […] Palace to the dyke (kilâtu) of the hanšû-land. Its upper side borders on Hahhūru and its lower side on (the house of) C. The land is cultivated by a group of slaves (amīlūtu) headed by D who shall not be divided (zâzu). As long as fA and B live, they will enjoy the usufruct (akalu akālu) from the land – after their death it belongs to their sons. 3 witnesses (including Erība/Marduk/Šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni and Nabû-bullissu/Širiktu//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
fA = fAmat-Sutīti/Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Nabû-bāni-zēri/Tabnēa//Esagil-lamassī; D = Iddin-Nabû; Scribe = Nabû-erība/Mušēzib-Nabû//Ahhia’ūtu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 5 kor (900 l) of dates, without interest (qaqqadu), and 0;0.5 kor of [x] commodity. The debt will bear an (yearly) interest of 0;1 kor (36 l) per 1 kor (180 l) of dates (20% p.a.). 2 witnesses (including Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe as well as two more individuals listed as witnesses after the date formula.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; B =Nabû-šumu-ibni/Kināya//Balāssu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin//[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 7;3 kor (1,368 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the Oven Gate (bāb kīri), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki) along with 15 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) as well as 5 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Mušēzib-Marduk//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. The accounts are not yet settled (epuš nikkassi qatû). The wages in dates (sissinnu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Ahūnu/Balāṭu//Siyāti; Scribe = Kalbāya/Amēl-Ea//Sîn-imitti

A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; B = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Nabû-zēru-iddin//Rēmūt-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Šumu-iqīša//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 ¼ shekels of silver, price (šīmu) for one sheep. The silver for the annual yield of shorn wool (gizzatu) and the offspring (tamlittu) is paid (eṭēru N-stem). They will divide the profit (utru) in equal shares (ahātu). In case A takes over (našû) the sheep, C will charge (manû) him with the entire amount of silver. The previous document is broken (hepû). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēreš/Zēr-Bābili//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Bēl-iqīša//Nūr-Papsukkal; C = Balāṭu; Scribe = Marduk-ēreš/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn//Siyāti

elementText.text:
Lease of arable land for cultivation: A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) arable land (zēru) in the hanšû-land of Esagil-mansi for 2 years to B. For the work he does on the land (dullu epēšu), he will give šibšu-tax of the field to A. 2  witnesses (including Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Šumu-ukīn//Attabani) and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy. The arable land associated with C1 and fC2 is not yet divided (zâzu D-stem).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Arad-Bēl/Mār-bīt-ēṭir//Iddin-Papsukkal; C1 = Gu-x-tu; fC2 = fAmat-[…]; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Rēmūtu//Rē’û ša Nabû

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute: A will not return and litigate (dabābu) with B about (ana muhhi) the silver which is (registered) in the account tablet (lē’û) of Nabû on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. They mutually put an end to their argument (dibbu qatû). 2 witnesses (including Dādia/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Niqūdu/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ša-nāšišu; B = Nabû-ittannu/Taqīš-Gula//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Taqīš-Gula/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Balāṭu//Nūr-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Placement of a pledge: B will dwell in the house of A for 20 minas of silver by 1/12 alloy per shekel (1 šiqil girê), property (nikkassu). It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). 5 witnesses (including Aplāya//Ilī-bāni and Nabû-kudurri-uṣur//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Siyāti; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Šabrū

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A1 and the sisters fA2 and fA3 7;4 kor (1,504 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) at the border of the ditch (harru) of Hurad Sūhaya. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. For each kor he will also give one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses (Kāṣir-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Širiktu; fA2 = fAmat-Sutīti, sister of fA3; fA3 = fAmat-Nanāya, sister fo fA2; B = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl/Per’u; Scribe = Nabû-[…]-līšir //Arad-Nabû//[…]

elementText.text:
Lease of land: B rents (ana sūti ṣabātu) arable land (zēru) of the hanšû-land of Bīt-Bibbē belonging to A. For 2;2.3 kor (450 l) dates he will give 3 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). He will deliver the dates in their entirety in the house of A, according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. The (tax of the) work (dullu) and the service of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu) are paid (eṭēru Stat.). He guarantees (pūtu našû) for the watering (šaqû ša mê) of the land and against the decrease (kuppupu) of the date garden and for leaving it lying fallow (puššuhu). 2 witnesses and the scribe. The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay (šalāmu D-stem) 2 shekels of silver.
 
A = Širiktu/Iṣṣur-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B  = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu;/Balāssu; Scribe = Arad-Nabû/Mār-bīti-nā’id//Nabû-šēme

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] amounts of silver with 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). fC, slave of B, is placed as a pledge and will serve A.
She is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). The silver which is intended for D and for which fC was taken as a pledge has been paid. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Šumāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. Broken clause mentioning B.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Kudurru//Ilī-bāni; fC = fBanītu-šarrat, qallatu (female slave) of B; D = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Šulāya//Šigûa; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-nādin-ahi/Gahal

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A 2;1 kor (396 l) of barley, without interest (qaqqadu). He will give the barley in Ayyār (II), together with a (yearly) interest (hubullu) of 0;1 kor per 1 kor of barley (20% p.a.). B will not plough (erēšu) the arable land (zēru) of another plot of land (qaqqaru). The clause about the fine in case B ploughs another land is broken. 1 witness (Šulāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūta-bāni; B = […]/Libluṭ//Ša-pî-kalbi; Scribe = Rēmūt-Gula/Mannu-kī-Nabû

elementText.text:
Division of inheritance: Tablet of inheritance (ṭuppi zitti), which the brothers A1, A2 and A3 divide (zâzu) among each other. 3/5 kor (eblu) (8,100 m2) of the garden (kirû) above (elēnu), located at the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) in the hanšû-land Illûa//Ilūtu-bāni, belongs to (pāni dagālu) A1. 3/5 kor of the garden beneath (šupālu), which adjoins (the marsh of) Aṣūnu, and 4 minas of silver as equalising payment (takpurtu), belong to A2 and A3. For all three brothers it is said that seed grain (zēru), additional payment (atru) and rations (kurummatu) from their part of the garden belong to them. 2 witnesses (including Nergal-ēṭir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A3 = Nergal-ašarēdu/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ahhia’ūtu

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A 1 kor (180 l) of barley, without interest (qaqqadu), and 1 kor (180 l) of dates. He will give the barley in its entirety in Ayyār (II) in Borsippa and the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in the house of A, both according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. The dates are the remainder (rēhu) of the impost (imittu) of the present year. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Broken additional clause about B who swears (tamû) by Bēl and Nabû to fulfil something (lost) in Ṭebēt (X). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; B = Šumu-ukīn/Mušēzib//[…]; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Lease of a house: Beginning with 25th of Addar (XII), B will live in the house of A, bordering the house of C, for 2 years. He will daily deliver 44 bricks (libittu) as rent (idū) for the house and the (adjacent) harbour (kāru). The responsibility clause is broken. 2+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-dūr-ēdi, qallu (slave) of Rēmūtu//Nuhatimmu; C = Nabû-ušallim/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Nuhatimmu; Scribe = Nabû-[…]/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//[…]

elementText.text:
Lease of a house: fA rents out to B a house adjoining the house of C for 3 ½ shekels of silver rent (idū) per year which will be paid on a monthly basis. B will give the daily (gift) of Enlil, kīnayātu-gifts and a date palm product (šugarrû). B is responsible for performing maintenance work (batqu ṣabātu) and the renewing of the roof (ūru šanû) within 3 years. The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay a compensation (târu D-stem) of 5 shekels of silver. 2 witnesses (including Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. The house is at the disposal (ina pāni) of B from the 1st of Tašrīt (VII) onwards.
 
fA = fAmat-Sutīti/Iddināya//Rab-Asê; B = Nidintu/Šulāya//[…]; C = […]-ahhē-iddin/Bēl-lē’i; Scribe = Mušēzib/Ṣillāya//Šangû-Ištar

He will also give 30 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) to A2 and 2 beams (gušūru) […] (re-bi-’ …) to A1. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni; B = Paddāya/Nabû-ahhē-uballiṭ//Šangû-[…]; Scribe = […]/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//[…]

This is apart from (elat) 0;0.2.4 kor (16 l) of sesame of A at the disposal (ina pāni) of B which he will give in Tašrīt (VII). 3 witnesses and the scribe.

elementText.text:
Distribution of barley: 13 kor (2,340 l) of barley, remainder (rēhtu) of the barley of the house of A, are delivered by B. Out of the this sum 10 kor (1,800 l) of barley are given by C on the 20th of Simān (III) of Nabonidus 11th year as rations (kurummatu) to fD1, 2 kor (360 l) to D2, 0;3 kor (108 l) – as thick flour(?) (qēmu kabbaru) – to D3 and 0;2 kor (72 l) to D4. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Kudurru; B = Murašû, qallu (slave) of Ardia/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Ilia; C = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fD1 = fEdia, mother of Tabnēa; D2 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Līšir; D3 = Nabû-iddin, nuhatimmu (cook); D4 = Zēr-Bābili; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A 2 kor (360 l) of barley, impost (imittu), šibšu-tax of the field of the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Halat of … (ku-pa-...). He will give the barley in Simān (III) in Borsippa. Per 0;1 kor he will also give straw (tibnu). 2 witnesses (including Bēl-uballiṭ/Širiktu//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A = Šaddinnu/Niqūdu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mār-bīti-iddin/Šamaš-ahu-iddin// Ša-haṭṭi-ēreš; Scribe = B

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes 30 kor (5,400 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru) of A, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Ṭābānu. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in the house of A according to the measure (mašīhu) of […]. For each kor of dates he will also give 1 load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). The (tax of the) work (dullu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; B = name lost; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Ezida-mukīn-apli//Ša-haṭṭi-ēreš

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 and fB2 owe A 1 ½ shekels of silver together with (adi) the silver of the sesame. B1 will perform the work (dullu epēšu) of A and A will give bread to B1. Each month the claim (rašûtu) due from (ina muhhi) B will diminish (maqātu Š-stem) by 1 shekel of silver until A is paid (eṭēru N-stem). fB2, mother of B1, guarantees (pūtu našû) for B1. B1 guarantees for paying off (eṭēru) the silver and the sesame, which originally was the claim of A due from C. 3 witnesses and the scribe. In addition (elat) B1 and C will give 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu).
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (temple enterer of Nabû); B1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-zēru-iddin//Kidin-Nanāya; fB2 = fBābu-ēṭirat, mother of B1; C = Nabû-nā’id/Iddin-Nunu//Šangû-Nabû; Scribe = Ezida-šumu-ibni/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Memorandum of two loans of barley: First, B3 owes A 16;1.2 kor (2.922 l) of barley, without interest (qaqqadu). Second, B1, B2 and B3 owe A 12;3 kor (2.268 l) of barley, without interest (qaqqadu). Both debts bear a (yearly) interest of 0;1 kor (36 l) of barley per 1 kor (20% p.a.). These memoranda (tahsistu) shall not be forgotten.
 
A = Šamaš-šumu-līšir//(Ea-)ilūta-bāni; B1 = Šellibi; B2 = Nabû-īpuš; B3 = Nabû-gāmil

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning a marriage agreement: A approaches fB and asks her to give her nubile (batultu) daughter fC into marriage with him. fB grants (šemû) the request and gives her daughter into marriage. fB voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives (as a dowry), together with her daughter, 2 minas of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) and 245 square cubits (61.25 m2) of the south wing (bīt šūti) (of a building) adjoining the houses of D1 and D2 as well as clothes, containers and furniture. fB will give the rent (idū) for the harbour house (bīt kāri). Each party has taken a copy (gabarû). At the sealing (kanāku) were present 5 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Nanāhu and Bēl-aplu-iddin/Šadûnu//Ilî-bāni) and the scribe. The tablet (ṭuppu) dating from the 26th Arahsamna (VIII) Darius 28th year is broken (hepû)
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; fB = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia//Ilī-bāni; fC = fLurindu/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; D1 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Iddināya//Ilu-šu-abu-šu; D2 = Iddināya/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Arad-Gula//Ir’anni

She will charge (manû) A with the expenses for the repair works and the renovation. 2 witnesses and the scribe.

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe the brothers A1 and A2 19 kor (3,420 l) of dates, imittu-impost of the garden (kirû) of Bīt-Apkallu, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. They will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). For each kor of dates he will also give a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) 3 kūṣayu date palms (gišimmaru kūṣayu) at the disposal of (ina pāni) B1. The dates for the (tax of the) work (dullu) and for (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are paid (eṭēru Stat.) by B1.
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Gimillu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Aqar-Nabû; B2 = Nabû-iddin/Nādin-ahi//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-kāšir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in the house of A, according to the measure of A. For each kor he will also give one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). The (tax of the) work (dullu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Mušēzib//Mudammiq-Nabû; Scribe = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Nabû-mukīn-apli

elementText.text:
Lease of land: Grain-cultivated land (zēru pî šulpi) of fA, which borders from the ploughed field (lit. “the blade (šinnu) of the plough (mayāru)”) at the dyke (kilâtu) up to C’s ploughed field, is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B for weed control (sippihu) and weeding (širindu). B will weed (šarāmu) the land and will scatter (sapāhu D-stem) the weed. For the land he will not let go fallow (nadû Š-stem), he will give šibšu-tax according to (akî) his upper (elû) and lower (šupālû) neighbours. Each party has taken a copy. 3+ witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
fA = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia//(Ea-)ilūtu-bâni; B = Nabû-ahu-ittannu/Re[...]; C = Kusupu

elementText.text:
Broken loan of bricks: 300 kiln-fired bricks (agurru) of Nebuchadnezzar 19th year which are stored at the Giššu Gate, 240  kiln-fired bricks of Nebuchadnezzar 20th year which are at the bank of the Šuhhu Canal and 60 kiln-fired bricks of Nebuchadnezzar 21st year – in sum 600 kiln-fired bricks which B owes A. A broken passage follows mentionining the father of B and a member of the Purkullu family. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūta-bāni; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Balāṭu//Arkāt-ilāni; Scribe = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-kāṣir//Allānu

A = Nabû-bullissu/Lâbâši-Marduk//Nūr-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Mušēzib-Bēl//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Iddin-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Transfer of dowry after marriage: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives to (his son-in-law) A, together with his first-born daughter fC who is now married to A, 0;3 square kor (8,100 m2) of land planted with date palms (zēru gišimmarē zaqpu) and an empty house plot (bītu kišubbû), which are located in the irrigation area (tamirtu) of Sūr-Amēlāti and adjoin the first arable land of 1 square kor (2,700 m2) originating from the dyke (kilâtu) of Bīt-Amû. This land is still due (babtu) from the dowry (nudunnû) of 1;3 square kor (21,600 m2) of arable land (zēru). B also gives fD1 as paternal assets (mulūgu) as well as in total 10 (pieces of) old and new household goods (udê bīti). As to the two servants (amīlūtu) fD2 and fD3 whom B has transferred to his son-in-law per written document (šaṭāru šaṭāru): B has given fD4 instead of fD3 and will release and give fD2 to his son-in-law until the end of Dûzu (IV). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni; fC = fKabtāya/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni; fD1 = fInbāya; fD2 = fIštar-šīminni; fD3 = fDidīti; fD4 = fBānītu-šarrat; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

A = Nabû-iqbi//Ahhia’ūtu; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-iddin//Ahhia’ūtu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 35;1.4 kor (6,360 l) of dates, previous and future claim (rašûtu). He will pay the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. This is apart from the previous promissory note (u’iltu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-rēṣūa; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Ilu-bâni; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Final settlement of a dispute concerning land: This record documents the settlement of a dispute concerning a plot of arable land planted with date palms (zēru gišimmarē zaqpu), located between the marsh (raqqatu) and the wasteland (kišubbû), part of the meadowland (ugāru) of the city of Ṭabānu in the district (pīhatu) of Borsippa. On the 12th of Nisān (I) of Darius 31st year A put a claim (paqāru šakānu) on this land against (ina muhhi) B. On the 2nd of Ayyār (II) of the same year A paid the full price of 7 minas and 17 ½ shekels of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy silver (bitqu) per shekel, but B did not transfer the land. Now it was decided that B will give back the full amount of silver to A. In return A will give B a tablet of the dispute (ṭuppi dīni) and (the promise) of not lodging a claim (ragāmu) to the field (eqlu) for whose arable land B will give A and his brothers 1 2/3 mina 7 ½ shekels of silver, remainder (rēhtu) of the price of the field. The dispute is settled in the presence of (ina mahar) 2 judges (dayyānu) (Mušallim-Marduk//Rēmūt-Bēl and Bēl-ittannu//Bēl-eṭēru) and 2 scribes (ṭupšarru) (Mušēzib-Bēl//Egibi and Arad-Nabû//Rē’i-sisê). Four seal impressions.
 
A = Bēl-erība/Rēmūt-Bēl//[…]; B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu

elementText.text:
Sale of clothes: A gives to B a túglam.lam-garment, which was given to him by C for 12;2.4 kor (2,256 l) of dates as fixed price (šīm hariṣ). B guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates to C. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-šumu-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Balāssu//Kidin-Sîn; B = Nabû-ēreš/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Šumu-ukīn/Šulāya//Arad-Nergal; Scribe = Rēmūt-Nabû/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ṣillāya

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe to A 6;2 kor (1,152 l) of barley, impost (imittu) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Qutānu. They will give the barley in its entirety in Ayyār (II) in Borsippa. The remainder of the main part of the tablet is heavily broken. 2(+) witnesses and the scribe. In addition they will also give 0;1.3 kor parched grain (qayātu) and 2 bundles (makṣaru) (of straw).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Tabnēa/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Sagdidi; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Šamaš-ahu-iddin//Rab-banê; Scribe  = Marduk//Nabû-zēru-ušabši

For the work he does on the land (dullu epēšu) [...]. For the land he will complete (qatû D-stem) (before the sowing), B will pay (šalāmu D-stem) the šibšu-tax of the field according to (akî) the neighbours. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin/[…]-Gula//Mannu-gērū-šu; Scribe = […]/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes 5 kor (900 l) of barley and 1;1.4 kor (240 l) of emmer (kunāšu), šibšu-tax of the field (eqlu) with 100 (cubits?) (50 m) front side, of the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Halat, share (pūt zitti) of A. He will pay the grain in its entirety in Simān (III) in Borsippa, according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in a single delivery (ina muhhi ēdi). 2 witnesses (including Šamaš-ibni, son of B) and the scribe. The service of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu) is paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Bēl-kāṣir/Rēmūtu//Ea-Eppēš-ilī; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-ušallim//Rīšaya
