elementText.text:
Lease of land for gardening: B rents for gardening (ana nukaribbūti ṣabātu) the arable land (zēru) belonging to A1 and A2 for 3 years. The rented land is located above (elēnu) the street (harrānu). The tenant guarantees (pūtu našû) for the digging (herû) of the field  after moistening (labku) of the soil, for the border (miṣru) and akkullātu-formation, for the digging of of the ditches (harru) and drain channels (ārittu) and for the watering (šaqû ša mê) of the land. He guarantees against the damage (batqu), the cutting (hepû D-stem) of the date palms (gišimmaru) and against their decrease (kuppupu) and leaving them lying fallow (puššuhu). For each square kor of land they dig out (herû) they will enjoy (akālu) 5 kor of wages in dates (sissinnu). A2 will divide (zâzu) the palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) of the entire land with A1 and raise (elû Š-stem) them. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Nādinu; B = Nādinu/Nabû-šumu-ibni//[…]matu; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Bēl-ahu-ušebši/Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Agreement concerning the delivery of misappropriated bricks: B, on behalf of (ina našparti) C, will bring to the Giššu Gate and give to A kiln-fired bricks (agurru) until the 26th of Arahsamna (VIII). B will bring these bricks instead of the 400(+) kiln-fired bricks of C, which he brought and handed over (našû-nadānu) to a citizen of Babylon. If B does not do so D, who guarantees (pūtu našû) for B, will pay 1 mina of silver as compensation of the shortfall (miṭītu) and damage(?) (iq-bi) inflicted (nadû) by B. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Ahiyyaūtu; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mār-bīti-iddin/Purkullu; C = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; D = Šamaš-ahu-ēreš/Rēmūtu//Sarbi; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Arkāt-ilāni

A = Bēl-kāṣir/Nabû-bēlšunu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Bēl-ēreš/Kalbāya//Pahhāru

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 9 kor (1,620 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the Garden Sūhaya. He will give the dates in their entirety in Borsippa, in a single delivery (ina muhhi ēdi). For each kor of dates he will also give 50 date baskets (gipû) of green dates (uhinnu), one load (of palm-frond ribs), date palm fibres (mangagu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). This is apart from (elat) the claim (rašûtu) of barley and apart from 6 kor (1,080 l) of dates, share (zittu) of fC. The wages in dates (sissinnu) and (the servcie of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses (including Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Iddināya) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Širiktu//Iddināya; fC = fKašāya; Scribe = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Bēlšunu//Rē’ûanu

elementText.text:
Work contract: For the period of one year (ṭuppi) B will be in the service of (našpartu alāku) A. Every month he will mount (ahāzu D-stem) 6 vessels (of 5 different types) and give them to A. In return A will give every year 1 kor (180 l) of dates. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Šumu-uṣur/Sîn-ahhē-iddin//Huṣābu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ēreš/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Work contract: From the 1st of Dûzu (IV) until the 1st of Abu (V) A is enrolled into service with B (itti PN uzuzzu Š-stem). B will give to A firewood (huṣābu) from his own (assets). B will enjoy (akālu) half share (ahi zitti) with A (in the profits of the joint venture). They will pay for the rent (idū) of the harbour (kāru) from their undivided property (karû). As much as B will manufacture (epēšu, propably referring to the manufacture of bricks, see Joannès 1989: 143), he will take away (našû). On the contrary, A will not take away anything from (ina libbi) what B manufactures. 3 witnesses (including Mušēzib/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. The one who violates (nabalkutu) the contract will pay 1 shekel of silver.
 
A = Nuhhu-Anim, qallu (slave) of Zēr-Bābili/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-alsi-ul-abāš, qallu (slave) of Ṣillāya/Rīšāya; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 50 shekels of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). The house of B, which borders on the house of C, is placed as a pledge. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). A will live in the house for 2 years. He will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the walls (asurrû) made of clay. Anything which is given in addition to (elat) ½ shekels of silver for the wetting down the clay roof (šinītu), B will pay off entirely (šalāmu D-stem). 3 witnesses (Arad-Bēl/Mušēzib-[…]//Nūr-Papsukkal, Nabû-ēreš/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Arad-Bēl/Marduk-nāṣir/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Nabû-kāṣir//Arkāt-ilāni; B = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Šumu-ukīn//Huṣābu; Scribe = Nabû-bāni-ahi/Nabû-būn-šuṭur//Rīšāya

elementText.text:
Lease of a storeroom: Beginning with the next day, A rents out to B the north wing (bīt ištāni) of a house for the rent (idū) of 6 shekels of silver per year. B shall pay 3 shekels at the beginning of the year and the other 3 shekels at the end of the year. A has access (nērebu) to the east wing (bīt šadî) where a female slave (qallatu) of his dwells. B will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the house and renew the roof (ūru šanû). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Bēl-ahhē-erība; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-libši/Aplāya//Ur-Nanna

This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 10 shekels of silver due from (ina muhhi) B2, father of B1. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Muqqēa/Šulāya//Nūr-Papsukkal; B2 = Šulāya//Nūr-Papsukkal; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nādinu//Rē’i-alpi

elementText.text:
Loan of sesame: B owes A1 0;0.0.1+ kor (1 l) of sesame, of the dowry estate (bīt nudunnî) of fA2, remainder (rēhtu) of the rented property (bīt sūti). He will pay the sesame in Tašrīt (VII) in the town of Sūr-amēlāti. 3 witnesses (including Nabû-bullissu, son of A1) and the scribe. The arable land (zēru) will be at the disposal of (ina pāni) B as long it is cultivated land (bītu mērešu).
 
A1 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fA2 = fKabtāya, wife of A1; B = Nabû-ittannu/Bēlšunu//Bā’iru; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Ea-kāṣir//Itti-enši-Nabû

elementText.text:
Lease of land for gardening: B rents for gardening (ana nukaribbūti ṣabātu) for 5 years 1;2 square kor (18,900 m2) of arable land (zēru) belonging to A1 and A2. The rented land is located at the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) and borders the arable land of Bīt-Ilūtu-bāni above (elēnu) and beneath (šupālu) the street (harrānu). The tenant guarantees (pūtu našû) for the digging (herû) of the field  after moistening (labku) of the soil, for the border (miṣru) and akkullātu-formation, for the watering (šaqû ša mê) of the land, for the guard (maṣṣartu) of the garden and for the digging of of the ditches (harru) and drain channels (ārittu). For 1 square kor of land they will enjoy (akālu) 5 kor of wages in dates (sissinnu). 2 witnesses and the scribe. B also guarantees against the cutting (hepû D-stem) of the date palms (gišimmaru) and against their decrease (kuppupu) and non-observance (šupšuhu).
 
A1 = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Nabû-ibni, nephew of A1; B = Nādinu/Nabû-šumu-ibni//[...]tu; Scribe = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B owes A 18 kor (3,240 l) of barley and 5;4 kor (1,044 l) of dates. He will pay the barley in Simān (III) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII) in their entirety without interest (hubullu) in the house of A. This is in addition to (adi) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 15 kor which A issued (e’ēlu) in the name of C1 and C2. 3 witnesses (including Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Gimillu/Bēl-epuš//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C1 = Šumu-nāṣir; C2 = Nabû-uṣur-inu’; Scribe = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Bēlšunu//Rē’âna

elementText.text:
Broken loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of scrap silver (kaspu nuhhutu) shekels of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. In a broken passage it is presumably said that arable land (zēru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Zabda, bordering on the field of C, is placed as a pledge. This pledged land is not yet divided (zâzu D-stem) with D1 and D2 and (produces?) 12 kor (3,160 l) of dates per year. 6 witnesses (Nuhša-Marduk/[…]//Nanāhu) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Kalbāya//Nanāhu; B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; C = […]/Iddin-Nabû//Ilia; D1 =  […]; D2 = Nabû-iddin; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Iqišāya//Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Purchase of a land: A1 and A2 purchase from B1 2/3 share (zittu) and from B2 half share (ahi zitti) of their land both located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Qutānu in the hanšû-land of Iddina-ahu/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni for 1/3 mina 1 shekel of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu). A1 received from A2 the entire sum of silver which is the payment of a half share and 1/6 of the second half share of the entire sum. The sealing of this tablet (ṭuppu) happened before the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Ibni-Marduk//Naggāru) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida ([…]–balāssu-iqbi). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-qarrād-ili/Nabû-tabnē-uṣur//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Nabû-tabnēa/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B2 = Nabû-uballiṭ/Ahi-maqar//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ahhia’ūtu

The payment is for the period from the 1st day of Kislīm (IX) until the end of Ayyār (II) of Darius 32nd year. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin; B = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; Scribe = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Lâbâši//Ea-bēl-ili

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). The debt will bear a yearly interest by 12 shekels silver per mina (20% p.a.). He will pay the interest (hubullu) per month. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ēreš/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.

A = Šamaš-zēru-ibni/Nergal-nāṣir//Adnaya; B = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Marduk-nāṣir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Ahhia’ūtu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes to the brothers A1 and A2 4;3+ kor (828 l) of dates together with 0;4 kor (144 l) of dates, remainder (rēhtu) of the dates of Nabonidus 8th year, impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Bīt-Zēr-Ibnāya, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). He will also give 3 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). 3 witnesses (all members of the Ea-ilūtu-bāni family) and the scribe. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Balāssu; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning a marriage agreement: A approaches (qabû) B and asks him to give his daughter, the unmarried woman (nārtu), fC into marriage with him. fB grants (šemû) the request and gives his daughter into marriage. B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives as a dowry (nudunnû), together with his daughter fC, 5 minas of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) as well as jewellery, pieces of furniture and various types of containers. At the sealing (kanāku) of the tablet (ṭuppu) are present 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Ahhia’ūtu; fC = fKaṣirtu/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Ahhia’ūtu; Scribe = Nabû-uballiṭ/[…]-ēṭir-napšāti//Ilšu-abu-šu

elementText.text:
Payments of silver: From the impost (imittu) of 3;1.4 kor (600 l) of dates, A receives from B 1 kor of dates, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of fC. Furthermore, 1;1.4 kor of dates are for the work (dullu) of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) and 1 kor of dates, harvest of the field of D, are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. 2 witnesses (Rēmūtu/Šumu-uṣur//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Dādia; B = Iddin-Nabû; fC = fAndia; D = Šumu-iddin/[…]; Scribe = Nabû-aplu-iddin//Pahhāru

elementText.text:
Lease of a house: B will dwell in the house of A, bordering the house of C, for the yearly rent of 10 shekels of silver. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for the repair (batqu ṣabātu) of the azmarû (= lance?) of […]. If he dwells in the house for two years, he will also renew the roof (ūru šanû). If he dwells in the house for only one year, he will renew half (ahu) of the roof. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Ṣillāya/Mušēzib-Marduk//Rīšāya; C = Līšir//Huṣābu; Scribe = B

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: The brothers B1 and B2 owe A 2 minas of silver – 1 mina by 1/12 alloy per shekel (1 šiqil girê) property (nikkassu) and 1 mina by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel capital sum (qaqqadu). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). The debt will bear an (yearly) interest of 6 shekels of silver per mina (10% p.a.). 3 witnesses (including Marduk/Saggillu/Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Bēl-ibni/Nabû-iqbi//Ilī-bāni; B2 = Nergal-ašarēdu/Nabû-iqbi//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Marduk-aplu-uṣur/Nabû-mudammiq//Purkullu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 13 kor (2,340 l) of dates, imittu-impost of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Sūr-Amēlāti, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, and 0;0.3 kor (18 l) of sesame, šibšu-impost of the harvest (ebūru) of 1 kor of arable land,  bordering the dyke (kilâtu) of the irrigation district mû, dowry estate (bīt nudunnî) of fC1. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in the house of A in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). He will also give a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). This is apart from (elat) the already paid (eṭēru Stat.) 4 kor of wages in dates (sissinnu), 1;2 kor for the harbour dues (kāru) and 0;3 kor for the service of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu). 2 witnesses (Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe. The dates according the promissory note (u’iltu) of C2 will be credited to (e’ēlu) D in the present year.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Balāssu//Mandidi; fC1 = fNuptāya/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni; C2 = Nabû-šumu-iškun; D = Nabû-šumu-iddin; Scribe = Nabû-kāšir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver for urāšu-service: A, on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, receives from B the payment for the urāšu-service to tow boats (šadādu) at the harbour (kāru), as much as is the share (zittu) of C. The payment is for the period from Simān (III) Darius 30th year until Arahsamna (VIII) of Darius 32nd year. 4 witnesses (including Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri and Libluṭ/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu, both from the Ilī-bāni family) and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ilī-bāni; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Širiktu//Ilī-bāni; C = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; Scribe = Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Ilī-bāni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A1 27;0.4 kor (4,884 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), share (pūt zitti) of the sisters fA2 and fA3, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa according to the measure of the king. For each kor he also gives one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) in the house of A1. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 3 witnesses (including Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) 2 date palm (gišimmaru).
 
A1 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fA2 = fAmat-Nanāya/Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; fA3 = fAmat-Sutīti/Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; B = Arad-Nanāya/Mār-Esagil-bāni//Širik-Nabû; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Lease of land for gardening: B1 and B2 rent for gardening (ana nukaribbūti ṣabātu) 1 square kor (13,500 m2) of arable land (zēru) above (elēnu) and 0;4 square kor (10,800 m2) of arable land beneath (šupālu) the street (harrānu) belonging to A for 3 years. They guarantee (pūtu našû) for the digging (herû) of the field (eqlu) after moistening (labku) of the soil, for the digging of of the ditches (harru) and drain channels (ārittu), for the border (miṣru) and akkullātu-formation, for the watering (šaqû ša mê) of the land and for constructing (epēšu) the wall (igāru). [Details about the construction of this earth wall follow.] A will give them 1 shekel of silver for this work. For 1 square kor of land they will enjoy (akālu) 5 kor (900 l) of wages in dates (sissinnu). They will also enjoy a third of the full-grown fruit trees (gapnu rubbû) and from those which are still to be grown A will enjoy a third. The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay (šalāmu D-stem) 1/3 shekel of silver. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Puhhuru/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība//Ašlāku; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir//[...]; Scribe = Nabû-lē’i-kalāma

elementText.text:
Lease of arable land for gardening: B rents for gardening (ana nukaribbūti ṣabātu) from (ina qātē) A1 arable land planted with date palms (zēru gišimmarē zaqpu), dowry (nudunnû) of fA2, for [x] years. The leased land borders on the marsh (raqqatu) of the Euphrates and on the fields (eqlu) of C1 and C2. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for the digging (herû) of the field (eqlu) after moistening (labku) of the soil, for the border (miṣru) and akkullātu-formation, for the digging of of the ditches (harru) and drain channels (ārittu), for the watering (šaqû ša mê) of the land and for the guard (maṣṣartu) of the garden. He also guarantees against the decrease (kuppupu) and leaving them lying fallow (puššuhu) of the date gardens. B will dig up (herû) the entire land and enjoy (akālu) 5 kor of wages in dates (sissinnu) per 1 square kor of land. He will not let go fallow (nadû Š-stem) the arable land between the date palms. The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay (šalāmu D-stem) 5 shekels of silver. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Broken additional clause.
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fA2 = fKabtāya/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ēṭir/Marduk-nāṣir//Šangû-Ninurta; C1 = Rēmūt-Nabû/Nabû-šumu-ukīn; C2 = Šamaš-zēru-iqīša/[…]; Scribe = Nabû-kāšir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Payment of debts: A2 is paid (eṭēru Stat.) from the hands of (ina qātē) B1 2 minas of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) along with interest (hubullu) according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of fA, wife of A2, in which C guaranteed (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the debts and in which the arable land (zēru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Ṭābanu – not yet divided (zâzu D-stem) with D – was placed as a pledge. fA has given the promissory note drawn up by A2 for B1 and B2.  In case a document (šaṭāru) concerning this debt (rašûtu, ra-[…]) will appear (amāru N-stem) in future, it belongs to B1 and B2. 6 witnesses (including Lâbâši-Marduk/Šumu-ukīn//Nanāhu and Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Kudurrānu) and the scribe.
 
fA = fTurinnītu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ahhia’ūtu; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Kudurrānu, husband of fTurinnītu; B1 = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Nanāhu; B2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Kalbāya//Nanāhu; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; D = Bēl-kāṣir; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin/[…]//[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 5 kor (900 l) dates. He will pay the dates in their entirety without interest (hubullu) in Tašrīt (VII) in Borsippa, according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. fC, the female slave (qallatu) of B, is placed as a pledge. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Šamaš-balātu/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Šabru; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fC = fNanāya-ittia, qallatu (female slave) of B; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Kalbāya//Nabû-šēme

elementText.text:
Agreement about the payment of rent: B will give on behalf of (ana muhhi) A the rent (idū) of the house until the end of the present month. The agreement is concluded in the presence (ina ušuzzi) of one witness who presumably is also the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili; B = Nabû-mukīn-apli; Scribe(?) = Ibnāya

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes fA1 1(+) mina of scrap silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). The debt will bear an (yearly) interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20% p.a.). fA1 is paid (eṭēru Stat.) from the hands of (ina qātē) B 15 shekels of silver according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2 due from (ina muhhi) B and 1 mina of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) due the end of Darius 18th year. The future and the previous promissory note of A2 on behalf of (ana muhhi) fA1 due from B are broken (hepû). B did not yet pay off these debts. Broken clause referring to arable land (zēru), dowry estate (bīt nudunnî) of fA1. 4 witnesses and the scribe. The border of the arable land extends from the canal to the dyke (kilâtu).
 
fA1 = fAmat-Nanāya/Balāssu//Nabûtu, wife of A2; A2 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/[…]su//Naggāru; B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; Scribe = Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Rēmūt-[…]//[…]-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment: A receives from B 2 ¼ shekels of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) according to the promissory note (u’iltu). The silver originates from the promissory note for whose return to B guarantees (pūtu našû) A. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Rēmūt-Nabû//Ilia) and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Basia; B = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; Scribe = Ahušunu//Basia

elementText.text:
Division of inheritance: B1 and fB2 mutually divide (zâzu D-stem) the arable land (zēru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Hallatu of A. [x] minas of silver are equalising payment (takpurtu). A is paid (eṭēru Stat.) from the hands of (ina qātē) fB2 [x] minas of silver which remains at the disposal of fB2. 3 witnesses (Nabû-ēreš and Mušēzib-Bēl, sons of A and Nabû-nāṣir/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Dādia/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fB2 = fBazītu/Šamaš-šumu-iddin//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nādinu/Balāssu//Kidin-Sîn

elementText.text:
Sale of two people: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives his female slave (qallatu) fC1 and her son C2 for 2 minas of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel in lieu of the dowry (nudunnû) of fA1. B received from fA2 the silver – he is paid off (etēru Stat.). fC1 and C2 forever belong to (pāni dagālu) fA1. At the sealing (kanāku) of the tablet (ṭuppu) are present 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fLurindu/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; fA2 = fAmat-Sutīti, mother of fA1, B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; fC1 = fNanāya-itti; C2 = Mār-bīti-iddin; Scribe = Itti-Nabû-lummir/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Huṣābu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes A 5 shekels of silver, property (nikkassu) of Nabû, for the bricks (libittu) of the city wall of Borsippa. The (number of) the bricks shall be according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of C. B will count (manû) the bricks in a pile (amaru) and give them to A. 2 witnesses (including Nādinu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Arad-Bēl/Zēria//Balāṭu; C = Murānu; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Nūr-Papsukkal

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver for urāšu-service: A receives from B payment for the urāšu-service to tow boats (šadādu) at the harbour (kāru) of Susa and an advance payment on the entire bow-service (panāt qašti), as much as is the share (zittu) owed by B. The payments are for the period from the first of Kislīm (IX) until the end of Ayyār (II) of Darius 32nd year. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin; B = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; Scribe = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Lâbâši//Ea-bēl-ilī

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes to A1 and the sisters fA2 and fA3 21 kor (3,780 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) bordering the ditch (harru) of Bīt-Apkallu, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa according to the measure of the king. He will also give 25 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 25 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). His wages in dates (sissinnu) are 3 kor (540 l) per 0;3 square kor (8,100 m2) of arable land (zēru). Additional (elat) wages are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B for the work at the canal (hirītu). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). This is apart from (elat) 2 date palms (gišimmaru) – they are to be called up (dekû). 2 witnesses (including Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe. Until (adi) the end of Ṭebēt (X) B will have completed and made full (qatû D-stem - malû D-stem) 0;1 square kor (2,700 m2) of arable land. 0;3 square kor are paid. For 1 square kor of arable land B takes 6 kor (1,080 l) of wages in dates.
 
A1 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fA2 = fAmat-Nanāya/Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; fA3 = fAmat-Sutīti/Nādinu//Ilī-bāni; B = Arad-Nanāya/Mār-Esagil-bāni//Širik-Nabû; Scribe = Uballissu-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//pa-ŠIH

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment of barley: A, by order of (ina našparti) his brother C, receives from B 1 kor (180 l) of barley. This barley is the credit (rašûtu) of D due from (ina muhhi) B. Each party has taken a copy. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 0;3.3 kor(?) (126 l) of barley(?) which A received from E on behalf of (ana muhhi) B. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; C = Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-šumu-līšir//(Ea-)ilūta-bāni; D = Nabû-lē’i/Marduk-ušallim; E = Iddināya/Nabû-ēreš; Scribe = A

Broken clause about the daily portion of 0;0.15 kor (90 l) (of dates?) of the compensatory payment (mandattu) of C. fA enjoys (akālu) the income (pappasu) and interest (hubullu) of the owed silver for the rental period. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fGugua/Dummuqu//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//Ilûta-bâni; C = Nuhānu, qallu (slave) of Mušēzib-Bēl; Scribe = Murānu/Bēl-iddin//Naggāru

This is apart (elat) from the previous promissory note (u’iltu) for which fC, slave of B, is placed as a pledge to fA. 8 witnesses (including […]-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ahhia’ūtu and Rēmūtu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Ahhia’ūtu) and the scribe as well as another witness listed at the end of the document.

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes to A1, A2, A3, A4 and fA5 [x];2.3 kor (90+ l) of dates, impost of the date garden in the hanšû rabû-land bordering the New Canal. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. The harbour dues (kāru) are paid (eṭēru Stat.). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid. 2 witnesses (including Mār-bīti-ēṭir/Marduk-ēṭir//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Kudurru; A2 = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk; A3 = Itti-Bēl-balāṭu; A4 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn; fA5 = fṬubbuṭutu; B = Nabû-rēme-šukun, qallu (slave) of Nabû-šumu-iškun; Scribe = Rēmūtu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilī-bāni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes of A1, fA2 and fA3 4 kor (72 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of Bīt-Apkallu, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa according to the measure of 1 pānu. He will also give 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 8 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 10 date palm fronds (libbu) and 5 date palm fibres (mangagu) in the courtyard (haṣāru). The (tax of the) work (dullu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Širiktu//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Nappāhu; fA2 = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia//llû-bâni; fA3 = fAmat-Nanāya/Dādia//llû-bâni; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-līšir/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Dialogue document concerning a marriage agreement: A voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) approaches (qabû) fB and calls on her to come and become his wife. fB grants (šemû) the request and agrees to marry and stay with A. She voluntarily (ina migir libbišu, mi-gi-il) gives to A as a dowry (nudunnû) 1/3 mina of silver along with various different pots and vessels. On the day A marries another woman, he will give 1 mina of silver to fB. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nidintu-Bēl/Bēl-ahu-iddin; fB = fTablūṭu/Nabû-šarru-uṣur; Scribe = Nabû-rē’û-[…]/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rīšaya

elementText.text:
Regulation concerning interest payment: Instead of the interest (hubullu) of 10 shekels scrap silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel owed by fB to fA, fC has taken the house of fB, by the remainder (rīhtu) of the price (šīmu) of […]. On the day fC dies (ina šīmti alāku), the 10 shekels of silver are put at the disposal (pāni dagālu) of fA. 3 witnesses (including Mušēzib-Bēl//Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, husband of fB, and Ṣilli-Bēl/Huṣābu, husband of fA) and the scribe.
 
fA = fAmat-Nanāya/Dādia//Ilī-bāni; fB = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia//Ilī-bāni; fC = fKabtāya/Murašû//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Murašû/Šumu-[…]//Ibnāya

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 1;1 kor (216 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is paid (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses (Šumāya/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-šumu-ibni/Nādinu//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Arad-Nabû/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe 5;1 kor (936 l) of barley, impost (imittu) of A1 and A2 together with the share (zittu) of A3. They will give the barley in its entirety in Simān (III) in Borsippa according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu of the king. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Dādia//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; A3 = Nabû-ana-merehti-ērih; B1 = Kudurru/Nabû-kēšir/Ahhia’ūtu; B2 = Marduk-ēṭir/Nabû-nāṣir; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Sippē

elementText.text:
Agreement concerning urāšu-service: A, on behalf of (ina našparti) C, receives (mahāru) from the sons of B payment of the urāšu-service (lúurāšu, lit. “an urāšu corvee-worker) to do work at the river (dullu ša nāri) until (adi) the end of the Šabāṭ (XI) of Cyrus 7th year. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ilī-bāni; B =[…]//Ilī-bāni; C = Arad-Nabû/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Itinnu; Scribe = […]/Nabû-nādin-[…]

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A [ ];2.4 kor (78+ l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest (ebūr eqli) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII), according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. For each kor he will also give loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). 2 witnesses (including Sîn-iddin/Zēru-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. He did not yet receive the (tax of the) work (dullu) and (the service of) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Balāṭu//Si’ātu; Scribe = […]-Marduk/Mušallim-Marduk//Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Contract about the performance of work: In the scope of the work (dullu) at the harbour (kāru) in Babylon which B performs (epēšu) on behalf of (ana muhhi) A, B gives in sum 3,000 kiln-fired bricks (agurru) for 1 mina of silver. Another passage about the counting of bricks and the payment in silver follows. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for the performance of the work and the guard (maṣṣartu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Dādia, qallu (slave) of Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Arad-Bēl//Arrabtu

elementText.text:
Purchase of a land: B1 and B2 purchase from A 0;0.3 square kor (1,350 m2) of arable land (zēru), a garden planted with date palms (kirû gišimmarē zaqpu), for ½ mina and ½ shekel of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu), including an additional payment (atru) of 1/2 shekel of silver. The land is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Hurad Sūhaya in the district (pīhatu) of Borsippa. Its upper side borders on the field (eqlu) of C1 and its lower side on the field C2. Its upper front borders on the field of C3 and its lower front on the field of B1 and B2. At the sealing (kanāku) of the tablet (ṭuppu) were present 3 witnesses (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni and Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Bēl-lē’i//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Šumu-uṣur//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni, B2 = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; C1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Pahhāru; C2 = Iqišāya/Arad-Nabû//Ilšu-abu-šu; C3 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Šulāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Receipt of taxes: In the course of the levy (dīku) of the months Ayyār (II), Simān (III) and Dûzu (IV) of the present year A receives from B 3 2/3 shekels of silver. This is apart from (elat) 1 shekel of silver C … (uncl.). This is apart from 0;0.4 kor (24 l) of barley which (t)he(y) took (našû, iš-šu-ú) from (ultu) the decury (ešertu) and apart from half a month (šapattu) which is withdrawn (nasāhu Stat.) from the urāšu service.
 
A = Šumāya; B = Ēṭir-Bēl; C = Nabû-bullissu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 1;3.2 kor (231 l) of barley, šibšu-impost of the field (eqlu) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Hallatu in the hanšû-land of Bīt-Ilūtu-bāni. He will give the barley in its entirety in Simān (III) in Borsippa in the house of A, according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-iddin/Mušēzib//Maṣṣar-abulli; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nādinu//Bitahhi

The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) 2 witnesses (including Itti-Amurru-tu[…], messenger [mār šipri] of Iqišāya) and the scribe (not identified).

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: The brothers B1 and B2 owe 27 kor (4,860 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, to the brothers A1 and A2. They will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure of the king. For each kor they will also give loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) and date palm fibres (mangagu). The wages in dates (sissinnu) are paid (eṭēru Stat.). For 1 kor of arable land (zēru) they will pay 0;3 kor (36 l) of dates for the service of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 2 witnesses and the scribe. This is apart from (elat) the 2 kūṣayu date palms.
 
A1 = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Širiktu-Marduk/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Gimillu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Aqar-Nabû; B2 = Nabû-lugal-gu4-si-sá-mu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Aqar-Nabû; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Šulāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment: A receives from B 15 5/12 shekels of silver. This is a partial payment according to the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 18 shekels of silver, price (šīmu) of sheep. Broken passage. Their mutual accounts are to be settled (epuš nikkassi qatû) until (adi) Tašrīt (VII) of the 30th(?) year. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Iddināya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Ana-muhhi-Nabû-amur, slave [qallu] of Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. B is paid (eṭēru Stat.) the silver for the vats from the hands of (ina qātē) A.
 
A = Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ēdu-ēṭir

elementText.text:
Lease of land: B will open (petû D-stem) and complete (qatû D-stem) (before the sowing) the newly cleared arable land (zēru taptû) of A located in Borsippa until the end of Tašrīt (VII). In accordance with what he will dig out (herû), B will be paid (eṭēru Stat.) in wages in dates (sissinnu) from A. For every kor of land he will let go fallow (nadû Š-stem), B will give 1 kor of dates. In addition, B and C will open the land for turning it into cultivated land (bīt dulli) which is due from (ina muhhi) them and give it to A. In this case the wages in dates are paid. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Iddin-Nabû/Rēmūtu; C = Iṣṣur/Nabû-kēšir//Bēlāya; Scribe = Rēmūtu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Rab-banê

He will pay in Dûzu (IV). 3 witnesses (including Marduk-ēṭir/Marduk-erība//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.

A1 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Šamaš-upahhir/Taqīš-Gula//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; Scribe = Lâbâši/Šulāya//Arkāt-ilāni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 60(+) kor (10,800 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the garden (kirû) of Bīt-Apkallu. B will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki), in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). For each kor he will also give 1 load (of palm-frond ribs) and palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). For each kor of dates he will receive 7 kor of wages in dates (sissinnu). This is apart from (elat) 1 ram for the 20th of Addar (XII) and 1 kor for the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) – these are paid (eṭēru Stat.). This is apart from (elat) 2 date palm (gišimmaru) – they are to be called up (dekû). 3 witnesses (including Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ea-ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//Ea-ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Šamaš-ibni//Purkullu; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: fB owes fA 30 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. fA will receive the interest (hubullu) for the silver from D until (adi) the end of Ṭebēt (X) of Darius 31st year. 2 witnesses (including Nidintu-Nabû, brother of C) and the scribe.
 
fA = fAmat-Sutīti/Dādia//Ilī-bāni; fB = fBu’ītu/Bēl-kāṣir//Bā’iru; C = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Rēmūt-Nabû//Ilia, D = Ahhē-iqīša; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Ilia

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 2 kor (360 l) of dates. He will pay the entire amount of dates in the house of A in Arahsamna (VIII) according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Bānia/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Eppēš-ilī; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-ušebši/Kudurru//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver, remainder (rīhtu) of 4 minas of silver of dowry (nudunnû) of fC from among which A already received 3 minas from the debtor. The missing silver is the silver D gave for the field (eqlu) of E which now is property of D. The debtor will give this silver in Tašrīt (VII). 1 witness and the scribe. Additional clause according to which fF will be at the disposal of A until all slaves (amīlūtu) are given by the debtor. Another additional clause mentions 5 slaves.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-ahhē-uṣur//Kidin-Sîn; fC = fHubbuṣītu, daughter of Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-ahhē-uṣur//Kidin-Sîn; D = Zēr-Bābili; E = Rēmūtu; fF = fNanāya-kilīli-uṣur; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Bēl-ahu-ušebši/Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Receipt for the payment of dates: A is paid (eṭēru Stat.) the dates due from (ina muhhi) B according to (akî) the promissory document (u’iltu). A will bring along and give (abāku-nadānu) the promissory note to B until the 25th of present month. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Aqar-Nabû; B = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = […]/[…]-ibni//sag-erin2-ni

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 16 kor (2,880 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru). He will give the dates, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor, in their entirety in Borsippa, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti), according to the measure (mašīhu) of A.  2 witnesses (Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Nādinu/Bēl-kāṣir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-pî-uṣur, qallu (slave) of Nūr-Marduk; Scribe = Esagil-šumu-iddin/Ēṭir-Marduk//Naggāru

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B1 and his wife fB2 owe fA 1 kor (180 l) of barley. They will give it back on the 15th of Tašrīt (VII). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû): the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). If they don’t pay on time, they will also have to give dates (details broken) until the end of the month [x]. Witnesses and the scribe not preserved.
 
fA = fGuzia/Tattannu; B1 = Ṣilli-Bēl/Per’u; fB2 = fAmat-Nanāya/Dādia, wife of B1

elementText.text:
Lease of house: From the present day on, fA gives to B the south wing (bīt šūti), her dowry (nudunnû), bordering the house of C, for the yearly house rent (idū) of 2 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû). fA has received the rent from B for the period of one year (ṭuppi). The transaction is concluded in the presence (ina ašābi) of Amti-Sutīti/Dādia//Ilia. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fLurindu/Mušēzib-Bēl//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, wife of Ahušunu//Nanāhu; B = Bāsia/Nabû-ittannu//Ilšu-abu-šu; C = Rēmūt-Bēl; Scribe = Bēl-uballiṭ/Ilia

A = Ṣilli-Bēl/Per’u; fB = fSilim-Bābu/Aplāya; fC = fAmat-Nanāya, wife of A; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Rēmūt-Bēl

They will pay the dates without interest (hubullu) in Tašrīt (VII). 3 witnesses (including Iqīša-Marduk/Šumu-ukīn//Ea-ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes to A1 3+ kor (540+ l) of dates. He will pay the dates in their entirety in Tašrīt (VII) in Borsippa in the house of A according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning [x] amounts of dates. 2 witnesses and the scribe. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the debts.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Miṣirāya; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; C = Nabû-šumu-uṣur//[…]); Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Bēl-ahhē-iqīša//Arrabi

elementText.text:
Contract for manufacture: In sum of 8 vats belonging to A are due from (ina muhhi) B for the manufacture of new containers (1 karpatu namharu, 2 namharu and 1 karpatu huttu). B will give the containers in Abu (V). 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ilī-bāni; B = Šulāya/[…]//Pahhāru; Scribe = Nabû-bān-zēri/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Rīšāya

elementText.text:
Donation of dowry goods: fA voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) transmits under seal (kanāku-dagālu Š-stem) half (ahu) of her dowry (nudunnû) and half of her other goods (mimma mala bašû, lit. “whatever there is”) to her son B1 (from her previous husband). The other half of her dowry and of her other goods she gives under seal and assigns to her husband B2. C will give to fA 1 mina of silver from his own share (zittu). The previous document (ṭuppu) which fA has sealed and given to C is broken (hepû). As long as fA lives, will the dowry be at her disposal (ina pāni). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, Širiktu-Marduk/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni and Qīštu-Marduk/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. fA has given duplicates (gabarû) to B1 and C.
 
fA = fHubbuṣītu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-ēreš//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, son of fA; B2 = Ēṭir-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, husband of fA; C = Mušēzib-Bēl; Scribe = Rēmūt-Nabû/Nabû-[…]//Basia

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 22 kor (3,960 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru) of Bēt-Zēr-Ibnāya, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. He will give the dates in their entirety in Borsippa at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki) in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). 2 witnesses (Šulāya/Arad-Nabû/(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni and Nādinu/Bēl-kāṣir//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe. He will also give 12 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu).
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nūr-Šamaš, qallu (slave) of Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nā’id-Bēl/Nabu-lē’î//Šangû-[…]

elementText.text:
Apprenticeship contract: C, slave (qallu) of A, will work for (ina pāni uzuzzu) the baker (nuhatimmu) B for five years. B shall teach him the craft of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) – the work of his craft (dullu qātišu) concerning bread made from ground (ṭenu) (flour?) and regular (sadru) (flour?). If B teaches the craft properly, he will receive [x] shekels of silver as income (pappasu). If B does not teach properly, he will pay (šalāmu D-stem) as compensation payment (mandattu) 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of barley per day. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-rēme-šukun, nuhatimmu (baker) and qallu (slave) of […]bahu; C = Līnuh-libbi-ilī, qallu (slave) of A; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nabû-bullissu

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2, deportee (šallu) of A, owe A 68 kor (12,240 l) of green dates (uhinnu), impost (imittu) of the palm groves (gišimmaru), at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. B will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa, according to the measure of A. 3 witnesses (including Mušēzib-Bēl, son of A, and Šamaš-ahu-iddin, son of B1) and the scribe. The entire palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) of A, that is, half share (ahi itti) of B2 from the wages in dates (sissinnu), are paid (eṭēru Stat.). The debtors will pay ½ shekels of silver for the fodder (hābu) of green dates.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Zēru-ukīn/Nabû-ibni//Pahhāru; B2 = Šamaš-iddin, šallu (deportee) of A; Scribe = Nabû-bēl-zēri//Ilī-bāni

elementText.text:
Payment of debts: Until (adi) the [x] day of [x] month of Darius 16th year B will give A 1 mina and 52 shekels of scrap silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. If he does not do so, his female slave (amtu) fC, who is placed as a pledge in lieu of the silver, will belong to (pāni dagālu) A. 6(+) witnesses (including Iddin-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ilia) and the scribe (lost).
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Ilia; B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; fC = fNanāya-rēṣūa, amtu (female slave) of B

elementText.text:
Receipt for debt payment: A1 and A2 are fully paid (eṭēru Stat.) by the debtor B according to (akî) their promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 11 kor (1,980 l) of dates. C and D will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) to B the promissory note of the business partnership (harrānu) until the end of the present month. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Etel-pî//Eda-ēṭir; A2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mušēzib-Nabû//Amēl-mār-bīti; B = Nādinu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; C = Bēl-iddin; D = Murašû; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Šulāya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni

elementText.text:
Lease of vats: 4 empty old vats belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The lessee will give the vats back in Abu (V). The lessor already received half (ahu) of the rent (idū) for the vats. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Nuhānu, qallu (slave) of Mušēzib-Bēl//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Huṣābu; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû//Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Kidin-Sîn

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A [x] amounts of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. They place their female slave (qallatu) fC as a pledge. She is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūtu šanû našû). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nidintu-Nabû/Gimillu//Ašlāku; B1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B2 = Iddin-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fC = fHadašāya’ītu, qallatu (female slave); Scribe = […]/Nādinu//Zērūtu

elementText.text:
Loan of sesame: B1 and B2 owe A 0;1.2 kor (48 l) of sesame, šibšu-tax of the field. They will pay the sesame in Arahmsamna (VIII) in the city of Sūr-Amēlāti. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Nabû-ittannu/Ea-kāṣir//Itti-enši-Nabû; B2 = Murašû/Šamaš-ahu-iddin//Kidin-Sîn; Scribe = B1

elementText.text:

fA = fBēlīt/Nabû-gamil//Bā’iru; B = Erība-Nabû/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-[…]/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Kudurrānu

elementText.text:
Payment of dues: A, on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, fully receives (mahāru eṭēru) from B payments of ilku-duty, as much as is the share (zittu) from the transporting (zebēlu) of upiyātu-revenue, and of urāšu–service at the harbour (kāru). He also receives an advance payment on the bow-service (panāt qašti) and hišāru (mng. unknown). The payment concerns a period from month [x] of Darius 21st year until the end of Ayyār (II) of Darius 25th year and happens under the supervision of (ša qātē) D1 and D2. Each party has taken a copy (gabarû). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušallim-Nabû/Nabû-mukīn-zēri; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Kalbāya/Nanāhu; C = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; D1 = Nabû-ahu-ittannu; D2 = Nabû-kāṣir, Scribe = Libluṭ/Padāya//Naggāru

elementText.text:
Payment of silver: A, on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, fully receives (mahāru eṭēru) from B silver, as much as is his share (zittu) for the urāšu-service at the harbour (kāru) of Nanāya and the digging (herû) of the canal. This is apart (elat) from [x] shekels of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) for the work at the dam (mušannītu) due from (ina muhhi) A which C received from B. Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-zēru-līšir/Arad-Bēl//Zērūtu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Zēru-ibni//Nanāhu; C = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Ibni-ili

A1 = Nabû-iddin/Zababa-zēr-ušabši//[…]; fA2 = fBēlilīti, mother of A1; B = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû//Rīšaya

elementText.text:
Receipt of taxes: A receives from B an advance payment on the entirebow-service (panāt qašti) as much as is the share (zittu) due from (ana muhhi) C. It concerns a payment for the urāšu-service to tow boats (šadādu) at the harbour (kāru) of … (place name broken), the flour tax (qēmu ša hirgalû) and for whatever … The payments are for the period until the end of Arahsamna (VIII) of the present year. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ibni//Nanāhu; C = Ahušunu/Bazuzu//Nanāhu; Scribe = Nabû-mudammiq/Etellu//Naggāru

elementText.text:
Short note about barley: In total 6 kor of barley in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) of C have been received (SUM.NA-tu4 = nadnātu, read SUM instead of šu-un, needs collation, courtesy K. Abraham). It is the šunnatu(?) barley (or šunnātu as by-form of šināti, referring to “the aforementioned (amounts of) barley”, courtesy K. Abraham) that D deposited(?) (nadû) upon (ina muhhi) the roof(?) (ūru) of C (partly uncl.).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl; B = Nabû-uṣuršu; C = Ibnāya; D = Bēl-iqīša

elementText.text:
Lease of land for cultivation: B rents from A1 and A2 65 1/3 cubits (c. 33 m2) of land of the irrigation district (tamirtu) […] in the hanšû-land of C for cultivation (ana errēšūti ṣabātu) of garlic (šūmū). In the first year A1 will give 2 ½ shekels of silver the newly cleared land (taptû) and A2 will give 4 shekels of silver. Broken clause about dues paid for 1 square kor land according to the neighbours within 4 years. The one who transgresses (nabalkutu) will return 1 mina of silver.  3 witnesses and the writer of the tablet (šāṭir u’ilti).
 
A1 = Nergal-ašarēdu//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; A2 = Nabû-mudammiq//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Hisū; C = Illūya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Writer of the tablet = Nabû-šumu-iškun/[…]-ibni

elementText.text: Administrative document concerning the distribution of silver: In sum 17 ½ shekels of silver from the property (nikkassu) of Šamaš are distributed for the half (ahu) Ayyār (II) to individual goldsmiths (kuttimmu). This is half of the capital sum (qaqqadu) of the goldsmiths.

elementText.text:
Agreement concerning the payment of debts: Each year in Nisān (I) B will give A a young (kalūmu) sheep from the cattle pen (hadiru). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Šamaš-šumu-iddin; Scribe = Marduk-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Sagdidi

elementText.text:
Agreement about the payment of dates: A debits (elû Š-stem) B1, B2 and B3 with promissory notes (u’iltu). He charges them with (manû), lit. “they counted) the 33 kor (5,940 l) of green dates (uhinnu) belonging to him and the green dates belonging to his brother C. The dates are entrusted to (paqādu Stat.) D until E, messenger of the governor, issues (e’ēlu) a promissory note (u’iltu) in his own name (ina muhhišu). No witnesses and no scribe mentioned.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun; B1 = Nabû-kēšir, B2 = Arad-Nabû; B3 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin; C = Nergal-ašarēdu, brother of A; D = Šamaš-šumu-līšir; E = Tabnēa, mār šipri ša šākin ṭēmi (messenger of the governor)

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 14 kor (2,520 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove (gišimmaru), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of Bīt-Zēr-Ibnāya, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. B will give the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa, according to the measure of A, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). For each kor he will give one load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) and date palm fibres (mangagu). 2 witnesses and the scribe. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). 
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya///(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Arad-Nabû//Ibnāya; Scribe = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Bēlšunu//Rē’ânu

elementText.text:
Loan of silver: B owes fA 4 shekels of white scrap silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu). B swears (tamû) to fA by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will pay the silver on the 21st of Abu (V). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fBēlilītu/Bēl-ēreš//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/[…]//Šarid

elementText.text:
Transfer of debt of dates: B transferred under seal (kanāku) the debt of 1 kor (180 l) of dates of the dowry (nudunnû) of fD, which A had imposed on (emēdu) him, to C. The promissory note (u’iltu) of A is issued (e’ēlu) in the name of B. C will bring and it hand over (našû-nadānu) to B. 2 witnesses (including Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe. Additional clause: C has received 0;1 kor (36 l) of dates from B.
 
A = Etellu/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Kidin-Sîn; B = Nabû-nāṣir; C = Dādia/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fD = f[…]ia; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Nādinu//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Lease of a warehouse: Beginning with the 15th of the present month A rents out to B the storeroom (bīt qātē) of the bīt asuppi-building for 2 shekels of silver rent (idū) per year. The tenant will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the cracks in the walls (asurrû) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). He will give the daily (gift) of Enlil, kīnayātu-gifts and a date palm product (šugarrû). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; B = Nabû-ana-aialuia/Bēl-pitinanni, širik Nabû (temple oblate of Nabû); Scribe = Mušēzib-Bēl/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ša-nāšišu

elementText.text:

A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-kāšir, rē’û (shepherd); Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Bēlšunu

elementText.text:
Broken agreement concerning the payment of dates: Until the 20th of Ulūl (VI) the dates according to the claim (rašûtu) of the promissory note (u’iltu) of fA1 due from (ina muhhi) B will be paid. Some more details about the payment, apparently also involving A2, husband of fA1, are broken. The responsibility clause is broken. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fSihūnu/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ša-nāšišu; A2 = Nabû-aplu-iddin, husband of fA1, B = Širiktu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; Scribe = Šamaš-iddin/Balāssu//Šangû-Inurta

elementText.text:
Sale of a mule: B1 sells one female donkey to A for the fixed price (šīm hariṣ) of 12 shekels of silver. As to the claim (rašûtu) towards B1 and B2, father of B1: A is fully paid (eṭēru Stat.). B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu). 2 witnesses (including Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Šumāya//Ilī-bāni; B1 = Nabû-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šumu-iškun//[…]; B2 = Nabû-šumu-iškun, father of B1; Scribe = Tabnēa/Šumāya//Esagil-mansi

element.name: Title
element.description: A name given to the resource

element.name: Object ID
element.description: CollectiveAccess record number ca_objects. object_id. Needed for data synchronisation purposes.

element.name: Museum No.
element.description: Museum number of cuneiform tablet

element.name: Julian date year
element.description: Year for sorting purposes

elementText.text:
Loan of barley: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 1;1 kor (216 l) of barley. They will give the barley in Ayyār (II) without interest (hubullu). A will pay at the harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Qutānu. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning silver. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-iqīša/Etellu//Saggilāya; B1 = Širiktu/Luṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk//Ilī-bāni; fB2 = fKabtāya/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ilī-bāni, wife of B1; Scribe = Sîn-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Esagil-mansi

elementText.text:
Loan of dates: B owes A 2 kor (360 l) of dates and 0;4 kor (144 l) of barley. He will pay the dates in their entirety in Arahsamna (VIII) in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu of the king and the barley in its entirety in Ayyār (II) in Borsippa. 2 witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-ēreš//Allānu; B = Bānia/Iddia

elementText.text:
Settlement of a dispute: A has returned and handed over to B (târu-nadānu) the document of the oath (šaṭāru ša tamīti), which he has drawn up together with B on the present day. They mutually finished (qatû) their former argument (dibbu). Where the document appears (amāru N-stem), it belongs to B. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Kidin-Sîn; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-uṣuršu/Libluṭ//Ša-1-luh
